quest_2.Name: Find Gravestones
quest_2.Description: Find all 6 gravestones in the little graveyard nearby.

quest_4.Name: Defeat the Wolf Trial
quest_4.Description: Use the wolf whistle at the teleportation platform in the forest South of Serbule, then defeat the mystical wolf pack that appears. It will be a difficult fight! Use cunning!

Objectives.Description: Kill wolves near the teleportation platform

quest_5.Name: Get Some Culture
quest_5.Description: Find some of the cultural lore items scattered throughout the town of Serbule.

quest_6.Name: Kill Deer
quest_6.Description: Kill 10 deer and return to Marna.

quest_7.Name: Kill Spiders
quest_7.Description: Kill 10 spiders and return to Oritania.

quest_8.Name: Kill Goblins
quest_8.Description: Kill 30 goblins and return to Oritania.

quest_9.Name: Kill Panthers
quest_9.Description: Kill 5 panthers and return to Kalaba.

quest_10.Name: Kill Fey Panthers
quest_10.Description: Kill 2 fey panthers and return to Kalaba.

quest_12.Name: Kill Giant Mantises
quest_12.Description: Kill 10 giant mantises and return to Sie Antry.

quest_13.Name: Kill Giant Snails
quest_13.Description: Kill 10 giant snails and return to Sie Antry.

quest_14.Name: Collect Giant Snail Shells
quest_14.Description: Obtain 2 perfect giant snail shells and return to Sie Antry.

quest_16.Name: Kill Tigers
quest_16.Description: Exterminate 5 tigers and return to Joeh. Tigers can be found northeast of Serbule.

quest_17.Name: Get Crystal Samples
quest_17.Description: Use Blanche's awl to chip the giant crystal near a lake somewhere around Serbule. You aren't sure what will happen when you do this. You've been told to be careful.

quest_18.Name: Collect Apples
quest_18.Description: Fainor the elf doesn't trust you since you're an animal. Collect 20 apples in the forest to convince him to do business with you.

quest_19.Name: Un-cow-ification
quest_19.Description: Harry says he'll give you some of his precious antidote. But you'll have to pay him handsomely for it!

quest_20.Name: Talk to Someone Who Knows
quest_20.Description: Maybe you should talk to Harry about how to fix your unfortunate cow-hood. If there's one person who knows animal transformation curses, it's Harry.

quest_21.Name: Unlocking the Crystal Lattice
quest_21.Description:
Velkort wants me to go grab a piece of blue crystal from a nearby crypt. The entrance is in the graveyard.

I'm to avoid the central room with the giant spider, and work my way around the perimeter until I reach an energy barrier. The secret code for the barrier is 397.

Objectives.Description: Snap off a small chunk of blue crystal

quest_22.Name: Fiery Secrets
quest_22.Description: Marna wants me to burn myself on the candles inside the nearby crypt. In return she'll teach me some first aid techniques.
quest_22.PrefaceText:
Hey, do me a favor, go burn yourself on some of those eldritch candles scattered around the crypt beneath town. I want to study the burn patterns. Each candle should leave a distinct burn mark. Just go touch four of them and come back.

Oh it won't hurt THAT much, you big baby!
quest_22.SuccessText: Hm, nope... not enough candles. I need more data than that! But a deal's a deal, let me teach you how to bind eldritch wounds a bit better. [You gain First Aid XP]

quest_23.Name: Fiery Secrets, Round 2
quest_23.Description: Marna wants me to burn myself on a total of 12 different candles inside the nearby crypt. I may not be able to reach all the candles right away, it's too dangerous... but I should keep it in mind for later.
quest_23.PrefaceText: I need more data. Can you go touch some more candles in the crypt? Say, a dozen. But you can count the ones you've already touched toward the total.
quest_23.SuccessText:
Damn it! Still not enough candles!

Well, let me teach you a bit about hammering out dents. [You gain Armor Patching XP]

quest_24.Name: Their Hairy Legs
quest_24.Description: Marna wants me to collect a ton of spider legs for her medicinal recipes. In exchange, she'll teach me one of her secret recipes.

quest_25.Name: The Bear in There
quest_25.Description: Jara's barn has been coopted by a huge grizzly bear. She'd be grateful if I could kill it, but she doesn't really think I'm capable of doing so.

quest_26.Name: Hogan's Request
quest_26.Description: Hogan the staff fighter has requested some items as payment for teaching you staff combat.

Objectives.Description: Get two giant snail shells (any quality)
Find a nice piece of poetry

quest_27.Name: Beneath the Red Crystal
quest_27.Description:
Velkort has told me the frequency for the giant red crystal. All I have to do is touch it while thinking the right word.

Once I'm past the crystal, I should try to figure out who's behind this and why.

Objectives.Description: Enter the cave beneath the crystal
Get to the bottom of this

quest_29.Name: Hulon's Bribe
quest_29.Description: Hulon won't let you use the Council Vault while you're an animal... if his superiors found out, he'd be in trouble. But he hinted that a suitable bribe would get him to look the other way.

quest_30.Name: Fiery Secrets, Round 3
quest_30.Description: Marna wants me to burn myself on a total of 25 different candles inside the nearby crypt! That's going to take a lot of delving.
quest_30.PrefaceText: Okay, last time. Just go touch candles until your hand burns off. Hyperbole! Relax! How about 25, just to be damned sure we've got it done?
quest_30.SuccessText:
Yes! That's it! See this pattern here? They burn tiny near-imperceptible scars into your flesh. It's a pattern, see? I think the dots make the outline of a snake. Weird...

Well, I'll study it more. Thanks! Here, take this.

quest_31.Name: Defeat Bleddyn
quest_31.Description: Jace Soral has asked you to defeat a hugely powerful werewolf named Bleddyn, somewhere in the forested part of the Kur Mountains. He mentioned that you'd need allies to do it. He also mentioned that silver weapons are extra effective against him.

quest_32.Name: Cheer Up Riger
quest_32.Description: When you first awoke in a cave, an elf named Riger greeted you. He seemed depressed, and asked for something to cure his depression. Unfortunately, he wasn't clear about what that might be.

quest_33.Name: Free Tortured Fairies
quest_33.Description: A Summer fairy named Fazzi taught you a ritual that you can use to free some Summer fae that are being tortured in the Winter Corridors.

quest_34.Name: Into the Kur Tower
quest_34.Description:
Landri the Cold asked you to enter the dungeon underneath the tower in Kur and find her old mentor, a necromancer named Lomas. She wants his skull as proof that he's fully dead.

Landri gave you a special amulet that can let you enter the ice barrier deep within the dungeon.

quest_35.Name: Convince Leonard
quest_35.Description: Leonard Allenson won't talk to you without proof that you're not a horrific monster. Conveniently, he knows the perfect way: bring him a stack of bacon.

quest_36.Name: Find an Amethyst
quest_36.Description:
An old elf named Elmetaph said he could teach you Teleportation. You just need to find an amethyst first.

He suggested you search around the old teleportation platforms for lost gems, but mentioned that amethysts might be anywhere on the island.

quest_37.Name: Find an Amethyst
quest_37.Description: An old elf named Elmetaph taught you some Teleportation magic. He told you to find a teleportation platform on the island and practice binding yourself to it. [ Stand on a teleportation platform and press the Recipe button on the right of the screen. Find the Bind Circle recipe and use it there. ]

quest_38.Name: Obelisk Math
quest_38.Description: Elmetaph thinks he can change your bind location to be 'somewhere' off of this island, which would let you teleport out of here. But he needs to do some calculations first. Get the info he needs by finding four obelisks on the island.

quest_39.Name: The Red Crystal
quest_39.Description: Yurra the hag suggested that you might find Davlos somewhere in Serbule. She said that an elf in town had been inspecting the giant red crystals that Davlos is known to make. Find this elf and see if she can help you.

Objectives.Description: Find Someone Who Knows About Crystal

quest_40.Name: Brain Bug Infestation
quest_40.Description: Yurra the hag said that the brain bugs infesting Serbule were made by Davlos. Find where they are coming from. They are most prevalent in the north, so search there for someone who might know more.

Objectives.Description: Find Someone Who Knows About Brain Bugs

quest_41.Name: The Fate of Commander Ferrows
quest_41.Description: A friendly mantis named Azalak suggested that the brain bugs in the area are coming from a cave west of him. Azalak asked me to find out what happened to a human named Commander Ferrows, last seen in that cave. In exchange, I'll get something that will be useful when encountering Davlos.

quest_42.Name: Chasing Davlos to Eltibule
quest_42.Description: Davlos isn't in Serbule. I need to find him. Eltibule is the next logical place to try.

Objectives.Description: Find someone who knows about Davlos

quest_10001.Description: Joeh in Serbule asked you to obtain some intact eyes from slain tigers. "Intact ones are pretty hard to find, but if you kill enough tigers I'm sure you'll get them."
quest_10001.Name: Get Cat Eyeballs for Joeh
quest_10001.PrefaceText:
The sewer system's a mess of poorly-planned portals, and tigers have been pouring in from one of them! Sir Coth is too incompetent to deal with them, and I'm too busy. Can you do it?

I need some proof that they're being handled. Can you get me a couple of cat eyeballs? Intact ones are pretty hard to find, but if you kill enough tigers I'm sure you'll get them.
quest_10001.SuccessText: Great! I mean, these are incredibly disgusting, but great, thanks for doing that! You're not such a loser after all!

quest_10002.Description: Joeh in Serbule asked you for a pig snout. " You need to be a pretty good skinner in order to get one, though."
quest_10002.Name: Get a Pig Snout
quest_10002.PrefaceText: I need a pig snout. A really good one. You need to be a pretty good skinner in order to get one, though, and I was never very good at skinning.
quest_10002.SuccessText: Hey, a pig snout! Thank you! It's an ingredient in a rare ink I'm making.

quest_10003.Description: Joeh in Serbule wants some bacon.
quest_10003.Name: Bacon for Joeh
quest_10003.PrefaceText: You know what would hit the spot? Some bacon!
quest_10003.SuccessText: Whoa, for me? You shouldn't have!

quest_10004.Description: Joeh in Serbule asked you to kill a tiger called "Old Fangsworth", rumored to live somewhere north of Serbule.
quest_10004.Name: Old Fangsworth
quest_10004.PrefaceText: Damn it, he's still out there! Mocking me! The only tiger to escape my blade! Old Fangsworth is a crafty beast; I admit he bested me when I was younger. I could kill him now, but I no longer have the time to stalk him and take him out.
quest_10004.SuccessText: You... you killed Old Fangsworth? For me? Well, I really needed to kill him myself. For the honor, you know? But I guess knowing that he's no longer out there mocking me is good, too. Thanks!

quest_10005.Description: Joeh in Serbule wants an astonishing amount of pork.
quest_10005.Name: Pork Party
quest_10005.PrefaceText: I'm having a party this weekend and I wanted to serve an insane amount of pork. Just... an INSANE amount! Could you help? I need a few more pork shoulders.
quest_10005.SuccessText: Thanks! Hopefully this will be enough food to impress people at the party.

quest_10006.Description: Joeh in Serbule asked you to retrieve a bunch of shoddy leather rolls.
quest_10006.Name: Leather Party
quest_10006.PrefaceText: You're a good sort. I should let you in on something: I'm fond of leather parties. Everyone wears amazing custom leather clothes, and it's exquisite! I'm throwing one soon, and I need a bunch of leather. Shoddy leather will do; these are costumes that will only be worn once, after all.
quest_10006.SuccessText: Very nice! I'd invite you to the party, but... well, maybe next time!

quest_10101.Description: Rita in Serbule asked for some flowers of any variety.
quest_10101.Name: Rita Wants Flowers
quest_10101.PrefaceText: Oh hi, can you get me a bouquet? I don't care what kind of flowers, just a half-dozen nice flowers. Thanks!
quest_10101.SuccessText: Great, thanks! I'm going to feed these to the sheep in town. He loves flowers!

quest_10102.Description: Rita in Serbule has asked you to discover the secret of Marna's beautiful long hair. Marna is a shopkeeper in Serbule.
quest_10102.MidwayText: Well hello! What? My hair? Oh that's easy: I use an alchemical potion twice a month. I should make some extra bottles and sell it! You look like you could use a bottle, if you don't mind my saying.
quest_10102.Name: Rita's Curiosity
quest_10102.PrefaceText: Marna's old, like sooo old. But her hair is so great! You know what I heard? I heard that back before the forest existed, she met a wanderer and helped him ... plant his forest, if you know what I mean, and as a side-effect she's got everflowing hair. Crazy, right? Can you find out if that's true?
quest_10102.SuccessText: She said her hair is due to a potion? Like, magic shampoo? I don't believe that for a second. Sigh. Well, you tried, I guess. So thanks, I guess.

quest_10103.Description: Rita in Serbulewants you to deliver some soap she made to Helena who lives in Eltibule, and can be found "somewhere in one of those little mini-castle things".
quest_10103.MidwayText:
A gift from Rita? Thanks! I guess she had fun at the... what is this, soap?!

...

Ha ha. Tell Rita to go suckle a treant, will you?
quest_10103.Name: Rita's Soap
quest_10103.PrefaceText: Oh, I made some floral soap for Helena. She lives way off in Eltibule though, in one of those little mini-castle things, so I haven't had a chance to give it to her. If you're headed that way can you give it to her? She's this cute but dorky armor vendor. She's always smelled a little... bad... so I thought... well, hopefully she gets the hint in time for my next orgy!
quest_10103.SuccessText: She said to suckle a treant? Well guess who's not coming to my party next month! She's such a stump anyway. I try to do some charity work and this is what I get! Anyway, thanks for delivering that for me.

quest_10104.Description: Rita in Serbule asked you to obtain a pair of comfy slippers. She mentioned Goblin Slippers are the most comfortable kind, but she's not picky.
quest_10104.Name: Rita Needs Slippers

Objectives.Description: Obtain a pair of Goblin Slippers

quest_10104.PrefaceText: Oh my birthday is coming up... in like six or eight months... and I thought of a great early present you could get me! Goblin Slippers! They supposedly make the most comfortable slippers of any race! I want green ones, but I'm not picky. You pick the color!
quest_10104.SuccessText: Well these look unusual... but thanks! I'll try these out tonight!

quest_10105.Description: Rita in Serbule asked for a flawless giant snail shell. "They're really hard to get. I heard you have to kill dozens to find one. But you're so strong and brave, I'm sure it'll only take you a second!"
quest_10105.Name: Rita's Shell Request

Objectives.Description: Obtain a Perfect Giant Snail Shell

quest_10105.PrefaceText: Oh I have a really big favor to ask! It's really hard but I'll totally make it worth your while. Can you get me a flawless giant snail shell? They're really hard to get. I heard you have to kill dozens to find one. But you're so strong and brave, I'm sure it'll only take you a second!
quest_10105.SuccessText: WOO THAT'S IT! You got it for me! Thank you so much! You're the best! Oh, and here's some potions! Remember to save one for my next orgy, I may just invite you!

quest_10201.Description: Mushroom Jack in Serbule asked you to deliver a very personal message to Therese down at the windmill.
quest_10201.MidwayText:
He said... oh, how vulgar. Why do I put up with him! If only Echur weren't so rough...

Yes, fine, tell "Mushroom" Jack I'll be there. But I'm bringing extra carrots. For him. He'll know what I mean.
quest_10201.Name: Message for Therese
quest_10201.PrefaceText: Take a message to Therese down by the windmill, will you? Ask her to come up here tonight for a good ploughing. And have her bring some root vegetables. I know how she loves those.
quest_10201.SuccessText: Thanks for delivering the message. She said what? Carrots? Not a problem. Hey, as long as they're not mushrooms, I don't care where she puts 'em.

quest_10202.Description: Mushroom Jack in Serbule has asked you to gather yet more mushrooms for him. He wasn't particular about what kind.
quest_10202.Name: Gather More Mushrooms
quest_10202.PrefaceText: You again? I need more mushrooms! MORE!

quest_10203.Description: Mushroom Jack in Serbule wants you to find and kill a dozen Myconians. He says he'll know when you've done it.
quest_10203.Name: Kill Myconians
quest_10203.PrefaceText: I don't know if you believe me or not about these Myconians. But I need you to believe! Go out there and find yourself some. And kill them! Kill a dozen! Then come back. I'll know you did the deed. The stink will be all over you. Go now. Do it.
quest_10203.SuccessText: Ha ha ha ha ha! You did it! I'm not crazy! I'm NOT crazy! But since I intuitively knew you did it, that means... I'm attuned to them. They're already inside my head. I am crazy. Damn! I...

quest_10204.Description: Mushroom Jack in Serbule has asked for 100 fish.
quest_10204.Name: Get 100 Fish
quest_10204.PrefaceText: Hey friend, do me a favor and get me a fresh fish, would ya? Wait, strike that, make it 100 fresh fish.
quest_10204.SuccessText: You got them? Great! Keep 'em, I don't want fish. I don't remember why I asked for them, actually. But here's something spicy for your trouble.

quest_10205.Description: Mushroom Jack in Serbule asked you for a Trophy Wolf Skin.
quest_10205.Name: The Perfect Wolf Skin
quest_10205.PrefaceText: Can you get me a perfectly preserved wolf skin? A trophy skin. I guess you'd need to be an expert skinner to get one... and even then it may take a few tries. I just need one, though, so it can't be that hard, right?
quest_10205.SuccessText: Perfect! I'll use this in front of the fire to set the mood tonight with Therese. Actually, wait, that would offend her. She loves animals. Nevermind, I'll just sell it. But thanks!

quest_10301.Description: Ivyn in Serbule has asked you to give him an Ancient Bronze Coin if you come across one while hunting.
quest_10301.Name: Ivyn Wants A Coin
quest_10301.PrefaceText: I lost my lucky coin. It was one of those ancient coins from before the Council. You can still find 'em all over the place... if you come across one, can you save it for me?
quest_10301.SuccessText: Thanks! Let me flip this coin to see what your reward should be! Aww, it's heads. Well, that means you get a beet. Sorry.

quest_10302.Description: Ivyn in Serbule asked you to buy three Squash Seedlings for him. Therese (near the windmill) sells them.
quest_10302.Name: Ivyn Needs Seedlings
quest_10302.PrefaceText: This is embarrassing, but I need some squash seedlings. I kind of insulted Therese the other day by calling her an... by calling her a name. So can you get them for me? I need three.
quest_10302.SuccessText: Thanks! Hey, do you have any use for this skinning knife? It will let you skin animals after you kill them. I don't skin animals because I'm a good, wholesome farmer. I grow crops. But you look like the animal-murdering type. So keep that.

quest_10303.Name: Ivyn Needs Butter
quest_10303.PrefaceText: I don't know how to make butter, can you believe it? And I'm a farmer! Heh! But I just grow crops. If I grew animals I'd be a rancher. So anyway, get me some butter?
quest_10303.SuccessText: Thanks! I owe you one! Here, this isn't really equivalent in value, but maybe you can use it.

quest_10304.Description: Ivyn in Serbule asked you to find the Demon Bean in the old spider-filled crypt in the cemetery.
quest_10304.Name: Ivyn's Demon Bean
quest_10304.PrefaceText:
I like you, so I'll let you in on a secret. My grandmother was an alchemist gardener, and they say her best creation was buried with her.

I'd dig her up and retrieve it, but an asshole lich turned her into a living skeleton. She's in the crypt outside of town. Can you put her to rest for me? And retrieve her Demon Bean?
quest_10304.SuccessText: This is it! The demon bean! In her notes, she said this seed could grow a Sampo. I'll finally be able to quit farming! Thanks so much! Oh, uh, here, take her old magic pants. I won't need them anymore!

quest_10305.Description: Ivyn in Serbule asked you to kill the Salmpo, a plant creature he accidentally grew. It's south of town.
quest_10305.Name: Ivyn Made a Salmpo
quest_10305.PrefaceText: So... my grandmother had a cruel sense of humor. I've been trying to grow a Sampo from her ancient notes - it's supposed to create gold from salt! But instead I grew a Salmpo. You know, the walking plant monster? It's horribly dangerous. Can you kill it for me? It's deep in the wilderness, south of town.
quest_10305.SuccessText: You got it? Good! Did you get its heart?

quest_10401.Description: Blanche in Serbule wants an antique spoon.
quest_10401.Name: Blanche Wants A Spoon
quest_10401.PrefaceText:
Someday when I've mastered geology, I'd like to learn more about Anthropology, too: the study of Humans! I guess primitive people just fascinate me. Did you know that Humans discovered cooking before they discovered fire magic? Really! I don't know how they controlled fire without magic, though. I guess that's a mystery lost to the ages.

Speaking of old human cooking, I heard there are antique Human-made spoons in the crypts and caves near here. Could you get me a sample spoon? It'd be fascinating.
quest_10401.SuccessText: Perfect! Spoons like these have been used by Humans for thousands of years, while they mastered the arts of soups and stews. Hmm, I don't think this one's more than a few hundred years old, though. But thanks anyway! It's fascinating.

quest_10402.Description: Blanche in Serbule needs a Simple First Aid Kit. She said an elf named Marna sells them.
quest_10402.Name: Bandage for Blanche

Objectives.Description: Obtain a Simple First Aid Kit

quest_10402.PrefaceText: I hurt myself yesterday... I dropped a red-hot rock on my foot. I thought I'd managed to get the swelling under control, but my healing magic has always been terrible. Could you go to Marna and ask her for a Simple First Aid Kit?
quest_10402.SuccessText: Thanks! This should have something for the swelling. It's been so painful that I've not even been able to eat! Here, actually: take my lunch!

quest_10403.Description: Blanche in Serbule wants some Boletus Mushrooms.
quest_10403.Name: Blanche Wants a Shroom
quest_10403.PrefaceText: I need some mushrooms. But I don't want to deal with Jack today. He's such a goon. Can you get them for me?
quest_10403.SuccessText: Thanks! Did you pick these yourself? You're so talented! I'm only good at geology. But, um, here! Have some powdered geology remnants.

quest_10404.Description: Blanche in Serbule has asked you to get a bottle of Weak Acidic Cleanser. (It's a moderately difficult Alchemy recipe.)
quest_10404.Name: Blanche Needs Acid
quest_10404.PrefaceText: Hey are you any good with Alchemy? I could use some cleanser for these gemstones, so I can cut them up real pretty. Could you get me some Weak Acidic Cleanser?
quest_10404.SuccessText: Thanks! Hey, let me give you some gems in exchange.

quest_10405.Description: Blanche in Serbule has wistfully mentioned her desire for a special wand carried by Khyrulek in the old tomb beneath Serbule.
quest_10405.Name: The Galvanizer
quest_10405.PrefaceText:
I heard that the lich Khyrulek kept creating weapons of destruction even after she died! Supposedly she has a wand that protects her from flame. If I had that wand, I could dissect it to learn the secrets of fire resistance. Wouldn't Velkort be jealous!

But it's just a fanciful dream. How would I ever get ahold of such an artifact?
quest_10405.SuccessText:
This... this is it? Fascinating... its full power is only unlockable if you're dead! Does that mean there's a connection between undeath and fire? Oh, I have so much to learn. This will be great! Thank you so much!

Here, take this. Velkort gave it to me once in a fit of passion. But I suspect you'll have more use for it than I ever will.

quest_10501.Description: Fainor in Serbule wants a bunch of cabbage.
quest_10501.Name: Cabbage Time
quest_10501.PrefaceText: I need to prepare cabbage soup for the town lunch. Can you get me fresh cabbage?
quest_10501.SuccessText: Thanks! Hey, you're all right. Let me show you how to make cabbage soup. Just don't tell everybody how easy it is!

quest_10502.Description: Fainor in Serbule wants you to get the recipe for Sweet Butter from someone in Eltibule Castle's courtyard.
quest_10502.Name: The Sweet Butter Secret

Objectives.Description: Obtain the Recipe for Sweet Butter

quest_10502.PrefaceText: Argh! I'm sick of buying Sweet Butter from Marna. She won't teach me the recipe. But I heard there's someone in Eltibule Castle's courtyard who knows the recipe. Can you get it?
quest_10502.SuccessText: Thanks! Wait, this... this is it?! MARNA!!!

quest_10503.Name: Those Deer Aren't Gonna Kill Themselves
quest_10503.PrefaceText: Hey, you're a champ, can you get me some venison? I need a LOT of it. I'll give you... hmm... my gratitude!

quest_10504.Description: Fainor in Serbule wishes to know the secret of Ur-Bacon, but the recipe is known only to the undead.
quest_10504.Name: Ur-Bacon
quest_10504.PrefaceText: If you were a REAL friend, you would get help me master the ancient recipe for forbidden bacon. Ur-Bacon is infused with the spirits of the dead. What a thrill it'd be to serve that! But of course, only the dead know the secret. You might find it written down somewhere, but it'd be incredibly rare. Sigh.
quest_10504.SuccessText: This... this is Ur-Bacon! You're a hero! I could kiss you! Thank you! Thank you! Here, take my [TBD].

quest_10601.Description: Sir Coth in Serbule has asked you to see if Rita has feelings for him. Presumably by asking her.
quest_10601.MidwayText: Sir Coth? That jerk up on the hill that keeps saying elves can't feel true love? I told that guy I'd date him if he just admitted elves are real people. He seems cute enough, but I'm not going to demean myself with an elf-hater.
quest_10601.Name: Sir Coth's Obsession
quest_10601.PrefaceText: I can't stop thinking about Rita. I know all elves are beneath me, but... oh, if only there was some way! But maybe I'm being a fool... can you find out if she has feelings for me?
quest_10601.SuccessText:
You see? That proves what they say about elves! A human would know that I can't just "change my beliefs" to suit her whim.

Here, Rita gave these to me when I asked her for a token of her favor. It was a joke, I suppose. I can't keep them anymore.

quest_10602.Description: Sir Coth in Serbule has asked you to kill skeleton archers in the graveyard.
quest_10602.Name: Graveyard Cleanup
quest_10602.PrefaceText: It's illegal to cremate the dead, of course, because they might come back as ghosts. But burying them's hardly better! The graveyard southwest of town is the worst case I've ever seen. Can you clean it up a bit?
quest_10602.SuccessText: Very nicely done! Thanks! Here's a little cash. Not that I think you're a mercenary or anything! Please don't take offense. It's just a gift!

quest_10603.Description: Sir Coth in Serbule has asked you to kill Augmented Mantis Slaves. They are past the farmlands outside of Serbule.
quest_10603.Name: Talking Mantises
quest_10603.PrefaceText: The usual population of giant mantises has changed. They can talk now! And they have deadly acid attacks. I have no idea what the heck happened, but they're no longer an ignorable threat. Can you stomp them out? I'm stuck here, defending the gate...
quest_10603.SuccessText: Good! Perfect! We're a well-oiled team! I know you did that just to make the town safer, but let me give you a bit of reward money anyway, as a token of thanks.

quest_10604.Description: Sir Coth in Serbule has asked you to go clear out the "sewer portal" which has become filled with annoying giant rats.
quest_10604.Name: Sewer Rats
quest_10604.PrefaceText: The Council didn't finish improving this town before they were called away to deal with the demon problem. So we're making do with very expensive magics. For instance, the sewer wasn't finished, so we used a bunch of portals to connect it! Smart, eh? Unfortunately those portals are two-way, and field rats have started living in the sewers, coming out at night to eat the crops in the fields. Can you go deal with the issue? Thanks.
quest_10604.SuccessText: That's what I like to hear! Let me give you a bit of money to cover your expenses.

quest_10701.Description: Velkort in Serbule wants you to obtain some Basic Spore Bombs for him. They can be made with a certain Mycology crafting recipe.
quest_10701.Name: Velkort Needs Spore Bombs
quest_10701.PrefaceText: In addition to being an expert fire mage, I'm also quite the alchemist. Mycology, however, is beneath me. Mushrooms are ... dirty. But I have need of some simple explosive mushroom bombs. Perhaps you know how to make those?
quest_10701.SuccessText: Good, good. I intend to augment these with the essence ... oh, nevermind what I'm going to do with them! You wouldn't understand it anyway. But here. Perhaps these will help you to be a less inept fire mage.

quest_10702.Description: Velkort in Serbule wants you to obtain a Brain Bug Lobe. He says they can occasionally be found from Brain Bugs.
quest_10702.Name: Velkort Wants A Lobe
quest_10702.PrefaceText: My research has hit a stumbling block. I need a specific item: the pulsing lobe of a Brain Bug. If only I had time to go out into the wilderness and search for them...
quest_10702.SuccessText: Why, thank you! And still pulsing. It's perfect. Here. Have some fire dust, it will help you in your studies.

quest_10703.Description: Velkort in Serbule offhandedly asked for some grapes.
quest_10703.Name: Velkort Desires Grapes
quest_10703.PrefaceText: Hm? No, I don't need anything. Wait, actually, have you got any grapes? I just want a snack.

quest_10704.Description: Velkort in Serbule mentioned some talking mantises in a field, and asked you to kill some and get their claws.
quest_10704.Name: Velkort Wants Acid Claws
quest_10704.PrefaceText: Those strange talking mantises out in the fields have weird runes on their claws. Someone drew those on them! Can you gather some specimens for me? I want to know more about them.
quest_10704.SuccessText: Fascinating. They're acid sigils, but etched right onto their bodies. Whoever did this is brilliant... they don't think about magic the way we do.

quest_10801.Description: Echur in Serbule wants you to deliver a bag of strange white powder to a "mantis" somewhere in the forests past Serbule.
quest_10801.MidwayText: Well done, humanoid, expectations have been met. And you did not spill the beans, as they say in your idiom. Feel pride, for you are successful in your task.
quest_10801.Name: Unusual Powder

Objectives.Description: Deliver powder to Azalak the mantis

quest_10801.PrefaceText: Yes, I am supposed to deliver a package to a friend of mine, a fellow believer in mind over matter. He's... not like us. More like... a mantis. Can you take this powder to him? Oh, and I must warn you: do not taste the powder!
quest_10801.SuccessText: He liked it? Great! He's going to refine that powder for me. Hopefully it works as well as he says it does!

quest_10802.Description: Echur in Serbule has asked you for a strong bandage.
quest_10802.Name: Bloody Bandages

Objectives.Description: Obtain a Good First Aid Kit

quest_10802.PrefaceText: I was ... um... "sparring" with Joeh yesterday and things got out of hand. I've been having nosebleeds off and on ever since. And I can't stand blood! Can you get me a more potent bandage?
quest_10802.SuccessText: Thanks! This should do the job. Here, take these leftover simple bandages. Don't worry, they're not used!

quest_10803.Description: Echur in Serbule has asked you to obtain a dose of Cranium Powder. He believes you can buy it from Azalak the mantis if you're friendly enough with him.
quest_10803.Name: Cranium Powder
quest_10803.PrefaceText:
So, um, our buddy Azalak the mantis owes me some cranium powder. I just haven't gotten around to picking it up. Can you get that for me? Oh, but, uh, don't tell him you're getting it for me. Don't mention me at all! Just buy it from him. I'll pay you back! Eventually.

You might have to get on his good side before he's willing to sell it to you. Just be nice to him, he's a great guy.
quest_10803.SuccessText:
Thanks! This will do for a little while.

[Echur inhales the powder.]

What? I have things under control. Cranium Powder's not that addictive as long as you know how to pace yourself.

Anyway, let's spar! I'll teach you a new move.

[You gain Unarmed XP]

quest_10804.Description: Echur in Serbule wants you to ask Velkort for a way to alleviate the symptoms of Echur's Cranium Dust addiction.
quest_10804.MidwayText: What? Cranium dust? Why that imbecile! An elf who doesn't know how to moderate his illicit drug use is an embarrassment to us all! Sigh...yes, I use it now and again, but I know when to stop! Sorry, sorry... I sound like my father. There's a cure for the side-effects, but I don't quite remember the formula. It involves mixing brain lobes with willpower gel - you know, that tawdry alchemical stuff. And there was one other ingredient, but damned if I can remember it. Sorry.
quest_10804.Name: The Cure For Cranium Blues

Objectives.Description: Ask Velkort about Cranium Dust cure

quest_10804.PrefaceText:
Okay so I have a problem. I admit it: I'm addicted to cranium powder. But it's okay. I'm a master of the mind! I just willed myself to stop.

Unfortunately I can't will away these nasty side-effects. I think I remember Velkort saying he dabbled in drugs like this when he was my age  can you ask him for a hangover cure?
quest_10804.SuccessText:
What? Brain lobes, alchemical gel, and something else? What else?! How can he not know?!

Okay. Okay. Not a problem. You can get me that stuff, right?

quest_10805.Description: Echur in Serbule wants you to obtain some Brain Bug Lobes. They can occasionally be found from Brain Bugs.
quest_10805.Name: Cranium Cure: Brain Bug Lobes
quest_10805.PrefaceText: I need to experiment until I find a cure for this cranium powder issue. Can you go get me some brain bug lobes? Better grab a few in case I mess up... I have a serious headache right now and I can't think too straight.
quest_10805.SuccessText: Perfect! I think I'm narrowing it down... won't be long now. I hope.

quest_10806.Description: Echur in Serbule wants you to obtain some Willpower Gel. Unfortunately he has no idea what that is. It sounds like a rare Alchemical recipe.
quest_10806.Name: Cranium Cure: Willpower Gel
quest_10806.PrefaceText:
I need to experiment until I find a cure for this cranium powder issue. Can you go get me some Willpower Gel?

I don't actually know what that is. It sounds alchemical, though. Maybe ask around, somebody might have it  for sale. I dunno. Just get it! Please!
quest_10806.SuccessText:
Yes! Thanks! I've almost got this recipe! I really appreciate your help with this. Let me give you something for your trouble.

I'm done with Cranium Powder, that stuff's terrible for you! I'm into the Pineal Juice scene now. All natural and incredibly powerful!

quest_10901.Description: Azalak the mantis asked you to get him some venison.
quest_10901.Name: The Nature Of Mantis Love
quest_10901.PrefaceText: I wish to mate with Zeratak, mammal. I wish it but it cannot be without my death. Do you see the issue? I must provide sustenance for the young, and traditionally that would be my body. A new tradition is needed. Perhaps some other creatures would work just as well. But I should get a lot of them... just to be on the safe side. Deer innards are preferable. But they run so fast!
quest_10901.SuccessText: Perfect! I will begin the mating ritual immediately! Well. Not immediately, there's no need to rush things. But soon. Yes. Soon.

quest_10902.Description: Azalak the mantis asked you to find some psi mantises that have snuck into Serbule, and discretely slay them before they bring the town's wrath down upon the mantis race.
quest_10902.Name: The Spies

Objectives.Description: Kill Psychic Mantis Spies in Serbule

quest_10902.PrefaceText:
We mantises were slaves of Dalvos, alongside those idiot brain bugs, for decades. But now we are free! And we seek culture desperately. It makes many of my brethren foolish.

Several fool mantises snuck into the town of Serbule in order to steal your culture. It has been many days, and I fear they will unleash a terrible reprisal upon us all. Go and find them, and do whatever is necessary to discretely resolve the issue. Murder would be the wisest choice. Yes. Murder them.
quest_10902.SuccessText: It is done? Good. I tip my hat to you. Top o' the morning, as they say in your idiom.

quest_10903.Description: Azalak the mantis asked you to question his fellow mantis, Zeratak, and see if she is interested in a non-fatal coupling.
quest_10903.MidwayText:
I do not understand. Azalak wants to mate, but does not want to die?  He suggests deer carcasses instead?!

The concept disturbs me. I am a romantic at heart. No. Tell him that I expect my suitor to bite the dust, as they say in your idiom.
quest_10903.Name: Wooing Zeratak
quest_10903.PrefaceText:
In captivity we were forced to mate like animals - the male giving his life to feed the younglings. But now that we are free, do you not agree we should adopt the culture of a more civilized race?

I wish to mate with Zeratak, but I fear that she will not understand my desires. She is a very conservative mantis. But seeing that most mantises fled for the hills yet she remained behind with me, it is possible that she wishes to mate with me badly enough to try a new method. Can you see of Zeratak is amenable to using venison for the larva? I would ask, but I fear she may lash out in anger.
quest_10903.SuccessText:
This is a bitter pill to swallow, as they say in your idiom.

I still believe there is a way. Perhaps if I prepared the venison specially...

In any case, thank you for your labor.

quest_10904.Description: Azalak the mantis needs you to collect a bunch of intact brains from sentient creatures. Brain Bugs occasionally drop intact brains, as do several other creatures, such as Nightmare Creatures and Psychic Mantises.
quest_10904.Name: Brains For Drugs
quest_10904.PrefaceText: Zeratak and I wish to make a living selling our special alchemical brain elixirs. These are traditional psi-mantis recipes, but I am attempting to hone them to be less toxic to other races. I believe that the lobes from the brain bugs are too potent... instead, I wish to grind up their entire brains. Or any fully intact brains will do, actually. I am a scientist. I am not picky.
quest_10904.SuccessText: Yes! Perfect. I shall extract the pineal juice from these. Here, take my most recent concoction, and Bob's your Uncle as they say in your idiom. I do not know what that means.

quest_10905.Description: Azalak the mantis asked you to create a dish of Venison Psi-Mantis Style. He intends to use it to woo Zeratak.
quest_10905.Name: Dinner For Zeratak
quest_10905.PrefaceText:
I still wish to woo Zeratak. I believe she would enjoy venison far more than mantis flesh if it was prepared appropriately. I have been experimenting with venison dishes, and I believe I have the recipe!

But I don't have any more ingredients left. Here is the recipe. Can you make it for me?
quest_10905.SuccessText: Perfect! Its odor is very appealing. This will be my ace in the hole, as they say in your idiom. Thank you.

quest_10906.Description: Azalak the mantis asked you to get his fellow mantis Zeratak to come visit him.
quest_10906.MidwayText: Azalak wishes to see me? Very well. I shall break a leg, as they say in your idiom. Tell him I am coming.
quest_10906.Name: The Second Woo
quest_10906.PrefaceText: Can you ask Zeratak to come visit me? I wish to meet her in broad daylight so that I can run if things go poorly.
quest_10906.SuccessText:
Oh good! This will be wonderful. Thank you friend!

[Scripted movement not yet implemented.]

quest_11001.Description: Sie Antry wants you to kill Giant Mantises near her homestead.
quest_11001.Name: Kill Giant Mantises
quest_11001.PrefaceText: Yeah, there's some mantises out there that are causin' trouble. Can you go whack 'em? They're getting too close for comfort.
quest_11001.SuccessText: Thanks! You're a peach. Here's something for your trouble. And let me tell you some gardening tips, too.

quest_11002.Description: Sie Antry wants you to kill Giant Snails near her homestead.
quest_11002.Name: Kill Giant Snails
quest_11002.PrefaceText: Oh for fuck's sake. Now the snails are gettin' too close! Go clear those out too, okay?
quest_11002.SuccessText: Thanks! You're a kipper. Here's something for your trouble. And let me tell you some gardening tips, too.

quest_11003.Description: Sie Antry requested two perfect giant snail shells. The giant snails near her homestead occasionally drop them.
quest_11003.Name: Collect Giant Snail Shells
quest_11003.PrefaceText: Can you get me some perfect snail shells? They need to be perfect, and those are harder to find. But I only need two of 'em.
quest_11003.SuccessText: Very nice! Let me show you what I make from these. Here, keep it!

quest_11004.Description: Sie Antry asked you to help make the trade path behind her homestead safer.
quest_11004.Name: Safe For Travel
quest_11004.PrefaceText: Used to be, some orcs would come by to trade. Made some good money, even if they are assholes. But rival orcs released all kinds of monsters in the area and now nobody comes here. Can you help make it safe again?
quest_11004.SuccessText:
Thanks! I only half want the orc traders to show up. They terrify me and the fairies, but I need the money!

But here... for all your work, have some of the money I got left. Orcs don't usually trade in Council money, they use the old crone coins like these.

quest_11101.Description: Elahil in Serbule asked you to deliver a bundle of arrow shafts to Joeh across town.
quest_11101.MidwayText: Ah yes, my arrowheads, thank you. Elahil's got you doing deliveries now?  interesting.
quest_11101.Name: Arrowhead Delivery
quest_11101.PrefaceText: Can you deliver these arrow shafts to Joeh in town? Thanks.
quest_11101.SuccessText: Here's your coin. Do you deliver things by trade? Oh, you only did it as a favor for me? Well, thanks.

quest_11102.Description: Elahil in Serbule asked you to collect some feathers.
quest_11102.Name: Feathers For Elahil
quest_11102.PrefaceText: My shipment of feathers didn't come in. Again. I wonder what's up? Anyway, can you collect some? There's a few chickens in town, but you can also find them in giant spiders' stomachs. They eat lots of birds! And there's lots of giant spiders in the cemetery crypt...
quest_11102.SuccessText: Perfect! Well... not perfect, these are pretty ratty feathers, but I can make 'em work. Let me repay you. Not in money, but in something even better: arrows!

quest_11103.Description: Elahil in Serbule asked you to obtain some Crossing Oil.
quest_11103.Name: Oils for Arrows
quest_11103.PrefaceText: So I heard the latest thing is these enchanted arrowheads that curse your target. Sounds great, right? But I'm kind of out of my depth here. I think I need something called "Crossing Oil", though. Got any of that?
quest_11103.SuccessText: This is it? Crossing Oil? Thanks! I guess I dip the arrow heads in this and they get magical? Huh. Well, I'll play with it. Here's some good old fashioned non-magical arrows as payment.

quest_11104.Description: Elahil in Serbule asked you to collect some Uncrossing Oil.
quest_11104.Name: A Soothing Balm
quest_11104.PrefaceText: Hey, so I just used that Crossing Oil you got me. I was making Curse Arrows. But I got it on my hands, and now my fingers are erupting in puss-filled blisters. Uh? Do you have the antidote? Uncross me!
quest_11104.SuccessText: This is it? Thanks! Elahil pours the Uncrossing Oil on his hands. It burns! It burnnnssss!Oh Belrath ready your White Halls, I'm dying... I'm... oh, it stopped. Hey, I'm all good. Thanks! That was scary. I'm gonna skip Curse Arrows.

quest_11105.Description: Elahil in Serbule asked you for some Nightmare Flesh to help him activate his magic ring.
quest_11105.Name: The Ring's Requirement
quest_11105.PrefaceText: So you know me, how I love magic rings? I splurged on a doozy that just came in from Statehelm! But it needs to be "tempered in the blood of nightmares." What the hell is that supposed to mean? Can you get me some nightmare blood, or guts, or whatever?
quest_11105.SuccessText: Oh gods, it's still moving! What in the hell! This is seriously wrong. Okay... okay, here goes. Elahil rubs his magic ring in the flesh. Hey, I think it's working! Here, you can have my old ring. This one's way better.

quest_11201.Description: Tyler Green asked you to obtain an "interesting-looking" shield, somewhere in the cave he's in. However, he said the path was blocked by a giant spider.
quest_11201.Name: The Battered Shield
quest_11201.PrefaceText: I'm kind of a shield buff and I saw a pretty nice old shield back in the cave past some skeletons. I had been planning to sneak past the skeletons and get it, but a GIANT spider moved in last week, and there's no way I can get it now. Maybe you can get past that spider? Or kill it, if you're insane...
quest_11201.SuccessText: Thanks! Oh. Huh. It's pretty neat, but not what I expected. Here, let me fix it up for you, and maybe you can use it! Tyler replaces the straps and repairs the weapon.

quest_11202.Description: Tyler Green asked you to get him some oranges so he doesn't die of scurvy in his cave.
quest_11202.Name: Oranges
quest_11202.PrefaceText: My teeth are getting kind of loose. I must have been in here a long time! Do you think I'm getting scurvy? You gotta help me. I need oranges!
quest_11202.SuccessText: Thanks! I hope it's not too late. My teeth are so loose... maybe there's an elven tooth tightener spell? Hmm.

quest_11203.Description: Tyler Green wanted you to go talk to Lawara, an elf in his cave, and convince her that she's more impressive than she thinks she is.
quest_11203.MidwayText: No, I'm just some elf now. I'm not... hey, wait. Did that weird human guy put you up to this? That guy is putting a lot of pressure on me. He wants me to regain my memories and then lead us out of this place to some glorious future. He needs to take care of himself, and I'll take care of me. Okay?
quest_11203.Name: Give Lawara Confidence
quest_11203.PrefaceText: Have you met Lawara, that elf back in the cave? She was near me when I awoke in here, and we escaped together. But really, I just kept myself alive while she killed everything with a trashy old bow she found. She's amazing. But she doesn't have any confidence. She thinks it was a fluke and she'd die if she tried to leave. Can you try to give her some encouragement?
quest_11203.SuccessText: Tyler sighs. Well, you tried, thanks. I think I used to be a shield-bearer for Lawara. But if so, it must have been a purely ceremonial role, because I don't think she uses a shield. And anyway, I obviously suck at my job, seeing as how we were both captured. I'll just stay in here and mope a while, okay?

quest_11301.Description: Charles Thompson, a vendor in a tent outside of Serbule, asked you to obtain some "strange dirt -- you know, the kind that you sometimes find under mushrooms or corpses."
quest_11301.Name: Strange Dirt
quest_11301.PrefaceText: A favor? Oh, well, I'm out of dirt. Not just regular dirt, you understand -- the strange dirt you sometimes find under mushrooms or corpses. It has a million uses! Most people use it for fertilizer, but I use it in potions. I just use a lot of sugar to mask the taste.
quest_11301.SuccessText: Ah, smell that dirt. It's... pretty smelly, actually. I guess I never really sniffed it before. Hm. Not the most appetizing potion ingredient, is it? Ha ha, no matter -- I use it because it has tiny fragments of soul stuck in it, not because it tastes good!

quest_11302.Description: Charles Thompson, a vendor in a tent outside of Serbule, asked you to talk to Mushroom Jack about the giant mushrooms near Serbule.
quest_11302.MidwayText:
Who? Charles Thompson? Never heard of him. But yes, I know what those giant mushrooms are for: they're psychic antennae for the Myconians! They use those mushrooms as beacons to control the thoughts of weak-willed people.

No, I don't have proof. Fuck your proof, just open your ears! You stay around those mushrooms long enough and you'll hear the voices, too!

Oh, and tell him not to eat the giant mushrooms. They're not only poisonous, they're also as hard as stone. Not a fun way to spend a weekend.
quest_11302.Name: Talk to Jack
quest_11302.PrefaceText: Before I was rudely kicked out of Serbule, I was trying to get in touch with a fanciful fellow that I'd heard lives there. He's an Elf, so who knows if he's trustworthy, but his name is "Mushroom Jack." Delightful, isn't it? Anyway, I heard he knows about those gigantic mushrooms on the hill nearby. Could you ask him what medicinal properties they have? I'm mostly worried that they're poisonous.
quest_11302.SuccessText:
He said the giant mushrooms are poisonous? Oh, that's too bad. I came a long way just for them.

What, he said they're psychic beacons for Myconians? What's a "Myconian"? He was just deranged. Elves get that way. Too much sex, I say.

quest_11303.Description: Charles Thompson, a vendor in a tent outside of Serbule, asked you to obtain a sample from the gigantic super tall mushrooms in Serbule. He suggests looking for a smaller offshoot mushroom, as the giant mushrooms themselves are hard as rocks.
quest_11303.Name: Giant Mushroom Sample

Objectives.Description: Obtain a Sample of Giant Mushroom

quest_11303.PrefaceText: I must know if those gigantic mushrooms off in the distance are edible. I know that "Mushroom Jack" fellow said they were poisonous, but he's an Elf. I want to try them anyway. But obviously I can't eat the giant ones if they're as hard as a rock... maybe you can find a nearby offshoot that's more edible?
quest_11303.SuccessText:
Thank you... oh. That really stinks! I'll analyze it to see if there's any redeeming qualities, but I doubt it. Drat it!

Thank you for your hard work, though. Let me remunerate you.

quest_11304.Description: Charles Thompson, a vendor in a tent outside of Serbule, has asked you to obtain a "heartshroom", but he has no idea where they come from.
quest_11304.Name: The Mythical Heartshroom
quest_11304.PrefaceText: Last night, a mysterious Elf came into my tent. He was wrapped head to toe in gauze and smelled like dirt -- it was terrifying! You never know what those sex-riddled maniacs will do. But he just dropped a strange thing on my bed and left, saying "study this heartshroom and prepare for the invasion." The so-called Heartshroom is actually an amazing type of mushroom that I've never seen before! It has incredible regenerative powers... this could make me rich! Err, make us rich. But I need more. Too bad I have no idea where they come from! If you find some, bring them to me?
quest_11304.SuccessText: You found more?! This is wonderful! Wonderful! Let me show you some of the ways this mushroom differs from the norm. (Charles spends a while showing you diagrams he's created. You earn Mycology XP.)

quest_11401.Description: Larsan in Serbule asked you for a topaz.
quest_11401.Name: The Beautiful Topaz
quest_11401.PrefaceText: I haven't been able to find a decent topaz in this miserable country. And it's my favorite gem! Could you get me one? I want to give myself an early birthday present.
quest_11401.SuccessText: Oh, thank you! This is... adequate. I appreciate it! Here.

quest_11402.Description: Larsan in Serbule asked you to deliver a special navel ring to Oritania, an elf in Eltibule Keep.
quest_11402.MidwayText: What? Oh. Yes. I ordered this ring from that shopkeeper in Serbule. But that was weeks ago! I suppose I still want it. Thank you.
quest_11402.Name: Oritania's Navel Ring
quest_11402.PrefaceText: An elf up in Eltibule Keep asked me for a special navel ring. It took me quite a while to find one around here, but I did it! Can you take it to her?
quest_11402.SuccessText: Thank you for delivering the ring! Here's something for your trouble. It's a hideous thing from my reject pile, but it's got some sort of magic in it.

quest_11501.Description: Leonard Allenson claims that there are strange runes buried among some of the corpses inside Borghild. He wants you to find some and bring them back to him.
quest_11501.Name: Hunt for Preservative Runes
quest_11501.PrefaceText: So Borghild has hundreds of buried dead, right? But no! Actually there are thousands of people buried here. When the older bones collapsed into dust, people would just reuse the old caskets. Some of those caskets are 500 years old and date back to the second dwarven control of Borghild. You know what that means: yes! Some of those tombs have dwarven preservative runes! Isn't it exciting?! If you got me some, I would be so happy.
quest_11501.SuccessText:
Is that... yes! You found them! These are going to be great in my collection of ancient burial rites!

Hm? Magical? Oh, no, these aren't magical. They're just a traditional thing dwarves do. But they never let outsiders have them! Very exciting! Here. Let me give you something for your trouble!

quest_11502.Description: Leonard Allenson believes there are golems inside Borghild, and asked you to find a Cranial Gear from the head of one.
quest_11502.Name: The Golem's Gear
quest_11502.PrefaceText: An old tome I found said there was an entire system of automata in Borghild: robots! Lots of 'em! They'd be sealed off away from the rest of the place now, I suppose. And probably all broken. But if you find a broken one, can you see if it has a large gear in its head? The book talks about something called a Cranial Gear. I'd love to have one.
quest_11502.SuccessText:
Uh... that's a LOT bigger than I expected! You must have found a huge automaton! Thanks for grabbing the gear for me. And hey, good thing the automaton wasn't still functioning, huh?

Hmm, I bet I could make a new kind of automaton with this! Come back later and I'll teach you what I discover.

quest_11601.Description: Roshun the Traitor in Serbule mentioned that he wished he had a Trophy Tiger Skin. They are rare items found by expert skinners.
quest_11601.Name: Perfect Tiger Skin
quest_11601.PrefaceText: I have many bear and panther skins to decorate my store. But the local beasts, the striped cats, should be on the wall, too! I have tried to get a skin but they are never perfect enough. I accept my limitations. I am not an expert skinner. It is enough to be a master warrior and an expert tradesorc.
quest_11601.SuccessText: This is not flawless enough. The cat was too small! This wouldn't look impressive next to the bear pelts. You have failed! But you were not required to even try, so I thank you. Hmm. You are a skinner, yes? Then perhaps you are a tanner as well? I skinned beasts while learning the art, but I do not know how to tan them, and they stink. Take them far from here.

quest_11602.Description: Roshun the Traitor in Serbule asked for some Perfect Oak Wood with which to create staves.
quest_11602.Name: Oak For A MasterPiece
quest_11602.PrefaceText: I am an expert staff fighter, but not an expert staff maker... yet. I wish to learn the trade. The mantises suggested that I start with worthless oak wood, but that is foolish! Even my first attempts will be masterpieces if I can find materials of high enough quality. Do you happen to have any masterpiece-quality oak?
quest_11602.SuccessText:
You call this masterpiece-quality wood?! This is junk! I had a piece of oak just like this one, and this is the quality of staff I was able to make. Pathetic!

But you tried your best. Let your dishonor in failure be small!

quest_11701.Description: Jake the Buckler in Sun Vale asked you to talk to Firaki in Amulna. He needs advice on what color to use for his next buckle.
quest_11701.MidwayText:
Oh, you're a friend of Jake the Buckler? That human is my oldest customer! Seems like I've known him all my life.

Okay, so he needs to paint the stripes on a tiger, but yellow overwhelms the pale green of the trees? He needs lemon chiffon dye. I don't carry it here. But I know where he can get it: tell him to find a mantis living outside of Serbule. The mantis can help him out.

Also, tell him that my advice costs 311 Councils, which is the exact amount I owed him, so we're even now.
quest_11701.Name: Expert's Advice
quest_11701.PrefaceText: So my masterpiece is almost done. I just need a better color for the stripes on the tiger. I need Firaki's advice. She's an expert on colors -- if anybody can figure out what color I need for my masterpiece, it's her. She lives in Amulna, a little town in the Ilmari desert. Can you go ask her?
quest_11701.SuccessText: Lemon chiffon dye? Sounds... well, not very heroic. But I trust Firaki. Thanks for asking her for me. Here, take these. Now, if you can do me another favor...

quest_11702.Description: Jake the Buckler in Sun Vale asked for a pot of Lemon Chifon dye. You previously learned that a mantis living outside of Serbule can sell you the recipe. There may be other ways to acquire the dye, too.
quest_11702.Name: Lemony Dye
quest_11702.PrefaceText:
So can you get me some of this lemon chiffon dye? Firaxi said some mantis in Serbule sells the recipe, right? How many mantises can there be?

Do this for me and I'll teach you how to make your own buckles.
quest_11702.SuccessText: This is it! Hm. It's... it's really ugly. But I'll give it a try. Thanks. And a deal's a deal: let me teach you the basics of buckle artistry.

quest_11703.Description: Jake the Buckler in Sun Vale asked for some iridium to make his buckle shine better. He suggested that it can sometimes be mined in Kur Mountains.
quest_11703.Name: A Brighter Glow
quest_11703.PrefaceText: I just can't get the buckle to shine like it needs to! You've gotta help me again. The Wombat told me about a magic rock called 'Iridium' which can make things glow. Find me some of this stuff! Womby said he mined some in the Kur Mountains one time.
quest_11703.SuccessText:
Huh, this iridium's not glowing. I wonder if I have to cast some sort of activation spell or something? Shit. I'll ask Wombat, he'll know what to do.

Thanks for the help. Here -- take my old backup buckle. In my younger days I was wearing this buckle when I got sent to a prison dimension. I spent thousands of years in limbo before I could get free. Ha, those were good times, probably! I can't really remember it well, but I met some fun people.

Anyway, when I came out, I discovered this buckle can't be broken. No matter what you do, it's unbreakable. Neat, huh? Keep it, because you, too, are fucking UNBREAKABLE! YEAH!

quest_12001.Description: Jesina asked for a dozen potatoes.
quest_12001.Name: Potato Dinner
quest_12001.PrefaceText: I've been so worried about my sister that I've barely grown enough food to keep us fed. Would you mind bringing me some potatoes? I'll give you a fair trade for them.
quest_12001.SuccessText: Thank you so much! Let me repay you with knowledge of gardening. Oh, and if that isn't adequate, here, you can have this pair of uncomfortable gardening gloves, too.

quest_12002.Description: Jesina asked for some Pick-Me-Up Juice.
quest_12002.Name: Pick-Me-Up
quest_12002.PrefaceText:
Sarina has been so unhappy since she came home. I know time is what she needs now, but maybe chemicals can speed the process up!

Can you get me some Pick-Me-Up Juice? It's an old alchemy recipe that puts a smile on your face for a while.
quest_12002.SuccessText:
Thanks! Now if I can convince her to drink one of these, maybe I can get her out of her bed for the first time in days.

Here, let me trade you. Sie has a bunch of these fire-protection potions lying about! I guess sometimes visiting orcs try to set the inn on fire.

quest_12003.Description: Jesina wanted you to pick some unusual flowers.
quest_12003.Name: Flitterbies
quest_12003.PrefaceText:
I think it'll cheer Sarina up if I make a bouquet of flowers like we used to have back home. But of course mom used flowers native to the fey realm...

Hey, actually, I know where you can get some! Look for the wooden pillars nearby. They were going to make a new city out there, but then they gave up. But they planted some Flitterbies early on, and those suckers are hard to kill! I bet there's still some out there.
quest_12003.SuccessText: Thanks! Ugh, they smell like home. I don't miss the fey realm, let me tell you! Except for all the fairy boys. I miss those. And mom. Jesina looks sad for a moment. Oh, right! Here, a reward for your effort! It's not much. I'm sorry.

quest_12004.Description: Jesina asked you to find her sister's backpack full of clothes. They're somewhere near an abandoned home.
quest_12004.Name: Sarina's Lost Clothes
quest_12004.PrefaceText:
When the Council was planning out the new town that never happened here, they built a model home to try to attract settlers. It's just past that hill over there.

So here's the thing: Sarina used to live there, alone, until goblins kidnapped her in the basement one day. She says she's never going anywhere near there again. But her clothes are there, and she's stretching out all my blouses! Can you go find her stuff?
quest_12004.SuccessText: Yep, that's Sarina's stuff. I bet she'll be happy to see it! Or else she'll be shocked and saddened by the memories these conjure. Hmm. Well, I'll broach it carefully. Thank you.

quest_13001.Description: Yetta has requested some spider legs.
quest_13001.Name: Spider Legs For Yetta
quest_13001.PrefaceText: Yes, actually... can you grab me some spider legs? I need them for new potions. Big or small, doesn't matter.
quest_13001.SuccessText: Thanks! Hope it wasn't a big hassle. Here's something for your trouble.

quest_13002.Description: Yetta has asked for some feathers.
quest_13002.Name: Feathers For Yetta
quest_13002.PrefaceText: Can you grab some feathers for me? Shouldn't be hard...
quest_13002.SuccessText: Thanks! Here's something for your effort.

quest_13003.Description: Yetta has asked for some sulfur.
quest_13003.Name: Sulfur For Yetta
quest_13003.PrefaceText: Okay a tough one... can you get me some sulfur? I have no idea where you'd find it around here, but I need some!
quest_13003.SuccessText: Wow, thanks! Here's something in exchange.

quest_13004.Description: Yetta has asked for some mandrake root.
quest_13004.Name: Mandrake Root
quest_13004.PrefaceText: This one's even harder. I'm sorry! But if you can find some mandrake root, I'd be really appreciative!
quest_13004.SuccessText: Thanks! You're amazing at this. Here, this is my own brew, try some! It's very expensive to make, but it makes you feel amazing.

quest_13101.Description: George Madler has asked you to kill a goblin named Fugorg. George thinks this goblin can be found near a giant statue in the wilds of Eltibule.
quest_13101.Name: Revenge For Slavery, Pt. 1
quest_13101.PrefaceText:
Goblin slavers killed my wife and child, and I've only recently escaped slavery myself. I've come for revenge against the chiefs most responsible. And I've tracked them to this area! But it turns out I'm not much of an assassin. Are you?

There are three goblins that need to die. The first's name is Fugorg, and he lives in the caves around here. But I hear he's on a pilgrimage to that weird statue out in the wilderness. Maybe you can find him there and cut his head off?
quest_13101.SuccessText: You did it? Really? Wow. That's one down, two to go! I  don't really feel like celebrating, somehow. My son is still dead. But you did well. Here. Let me teach you a few tricks of my trade in exchange. And, of course, here's the money I'd been saving up to pay for this assassination!

quest_13102.Description: George Madler has asked you to kill a goblin named Algapa. George thinks this goblin can be found in the dungeons beneath Eltibule Keep.
quest_13102.Name: Revenge For Slavery, Pt. 2
quest_13102.PrefaceText: The second goblin was the ship captain that held my wife as a slave. But that ship sank. So instead, I'll take revenge on his son, Algapa. Seems fair, right? And best of all, his son is right here! He's trying to make a name for himself under Eltibule Keep! I bet it'll be no trouble to kill him. Well... probably a little trouble. But it would help me sleep at night.
quest_13102.SuccessText: Algapa is dead? Hah! If only his father was still alive to weep for him. But no matter. Thank you. Here, let me give you what I can.

quest_13103.Description: George Madler asked you to kill a bear named Graz. He doesn't know where Graz lives, though, except that it's likely in a cave filled with goblins.
quest_13103.Name: Revenge For Slavery, Pt. 3
quest_13103.PrefaceText: The third person I need revenge on isn't really a goblin at all. It's a bear. A bear named Graz, famous for eating disobedient slaves. I lost track of where they'd moved Graz. There were some cave-ins around here recently, and the tribe that owned him is missing. Hell, Graz may be dead already. I just need to know Graz will never hurt another slave. Can you make sure of that?
quest_13103.SuccessText: Graz is dead? Graz is dead! Yes! That's wonderful news! Thank you so much!

quest_13104.Description: George Madler asked you for some cotton.
quest_13104.Name: Get Some Cotton
quest_13104.PrefaceText: Hey, if you're headed out into the wilds, mind picking any cotton you see for me?
quest_13104.SuccessText: Thanks. Here's some coin for your trouble!

quest_13105.Description: George Madler asked you to get some red asters. He's going to use the flowers to create dye.
quest_13105.Name: Flowers for Dye Practice
quest_13105.PrefaceText: I've been experimenting with dyes, but I still haven't really got the hang of it. Ran out of raw materials, though! Could you help? I need some more of those red flowers that grow here. Red asters I think they're called.
quest_13105.SuccessText: Thanks. Here's some coin for your trouble!

quest_13201.Name: Milk!
quest_13201.PrefaceText: I need more milk! Always more milk! Those damned cows out there are so violent, too. Why can't they just calmly let me milk them?
quest_13201.SuccessText: Milk! Thank you! That was kind of you.

quest_13202.Description: Braigon mentioned needing more stomachs to make rennet.
quest_13202.Name: Stomachs!
quest_13202.PrefaceText: I wish I was a butcher. They must be overflowing with animal stomachs! But not me. My last batch of cheese used vegetarian rennet. Eugh! If you find some stomachs, save me a few, would you?
quest_13202.SuccessText:
Ohh perfect! These are perfect! I'm going to make some rennet right now.

Looks like I have too many of these, would you like them?

quest_13203.Description:
Braigon wants a perfect cow hide for an experimental cheese he's making.

(Perfect Cow Hides come from expert skinners who have mastered bovine anatomy. They're quite rare!)
quest_13203.Name: The Perfect Cow Hide
quest_13203.PrefaceText:
I have this crazy recipe for cheese that ripens within the hide of a cow. Crazy gimmick, right?! Trouble is, it requires a perfectly-skinned cow hide. I'm a pretty terrible skinner, so that's not going to happen.

But if you happen upon one, save it for me!
quest_13203.SuccessText: That's perfect! A perfect hide! Did you skin this yourself? No matter, no matter. What's important is that it's mine now, and I can get to work on this Cow's Paradise cheese! Here. Some of my private cheese stock should be ample payment!

quest_13204.Description: Braigon needs more quarter hoops for barrel making.
quest_13204.Name: Quarter Hoops!
quest_13204.PrefaceText: Gods, I am so sick of making barrels! It's so hard! And so stupid! Sigh... and I just ran out of quarter hoops. Great. Just great. That means I have to talk that idiot Kalaba into making me some more.
quest_13204.SuccessText: You got these just for me? Wow. Wow! That was really kind of you. Here, try this. It's my latest batch. Oh and let me give you some coin to cover your expenses.

quest_13301.Description: Helena Veilmoor in Hogan's Keep asked you to get something written by the poet Gruzark. She didn't seem to know where Gruzark lives, though.
quest_13301.Name: Gruzark's Works
quest_13301.PrefaceText:
Both Hogan and I love poetry -- we met at a reading in the Vicious Bat in Statehelm. I miss my hometown a lot.

Hey, I heard that a  poet named Gruzark lives around here. I'm not sure where, exactly. But can you get me his autograph? Or just something he wrote? I'd really appreciate it!
quest_13301.SuccessText: You found Gruzark? He's dead?! Oh. Well, I guess that means this book will go up in value! Thanks. Here... it's one of my swords. It's got some silly enchantment on it, maybe that'll be fun for you.

quest_13302.Description: Helena Veilmoor in Hogan's Keep asked you to obtain some obsidians so she can pay off her debtors before they cut off her head and lay eggs down her neck. But no rush.
quest_13302.Name: Paying Debts
quest_13302.PrefaceText: I... kind of have a gambling problem. Had a gambling problem. I'm better now! But there's these mantises that I owe money to. Like, several million councils. Don't look at me like that! How was I supposed to know they were psychics?! So, yeah. They're gonna rip off my head and lay eggs in my neck unless I get them their money. But they said they'd give me more time if I got them some gems they want. I've gotten a lot of them, but I need a few more. If you happened upon some obsidian, save them for me?
quest_13302.SuccessText: You got it? Whew! You saved my life for another month! Let me get you something.

quest_13303.Description: Helena Veilmoor in Hogan's Keep asked you to get some "hook-claw things."
quest_13303.Name: Hooks
quest_13303.PrefaceText:
I like Hogan a lot. And more importantly, he can protect me from the mantises if they come looking for me here. I wanted to get him something nice, to stay on his good side. Can you help?

Hogan keeps talking about a "claw-staff" he wants to make. But he needs some sort of hook claw things to make it. Can you get some of those, whatever they are?
quest_13303.SuccessText: Are those them? Wow. I guess, yeah, that'd make a pretty good staff! Let me give you something nice for your trouble! Do you like drugs? I'm trying to quit. Take my stash.

quest_13304.Description: Helena Veilmoor in Hogan's Keep asked you to get some game chips. She wasn't picky about the type.
quest_13304.Name: Game Night Is Calling
quest_13304.PrefaceText: It's just so boring here! I figured maybe I could get a card game going. But I need some supplies! Can you get me some game chips? Whatever denomination doesn't matter. I just need a handful of them to get the games started!
quest_13304.SuccessText: Ah hahaha perfect! I'm gonna make a killing with these! Thanks! Hey, you want this dumb thing? Take it!

quest_13401.Description: Hogan in Hogan's Keep asked you to kill Gnasher Matriarchs. He says they are west of his keep, near the waterfall.
quest_13401.Name: Preventing a Predictable Problem
quest_13401.PrefaceText:
Sie Antry and I have been working to keep the roads safe, but it's a very hard battle. But I foresee a new problem that I'd like to nip in the bud. Can you help?

To the west of here, near the waterfall, a herd of Gnashers has moved in. And they're breeding! This will be very bad soon. Can you kill off some of the Gnasher Matriarchs before the whole land is overrun?
quest_13401.SuccessText: Good. Good! You're quite a proficient warrior! Here. Perhaps you will have use of this.

quest_13402.Description: Hogan in Hogan's Keep asked you to collect some guavas.
quest_13402.Name: Guavas of the Land
quest_13402.PrefaceText: I'm a bit of a fruit nut. (Do you get it?) I love the guavas that grow around here. Wish I had time to collect some.
quest_13402.SuccessText: Guavas! Thank you very much. Let me teach you a preparation technique for these.

quest_13403.Description: Hogan in Hogan's Keep asked you to visit Sie Antry at her home southwest of Hogan's Keep.
quest_13403.MidwayText:
Oh, don't you start with me! Hogan hasn't killed a single damned Tor-Urak in months! If it's not right outside his castle gate, he doesn't give a crap about it. I work my ass off, and he has the gall to suggest...

Sorry, kid. I don't mean to get you mixed up in this. I'll take it up with him tomorrow.
quest_13403.Name: Sie's Roadside Assistance
quest_13403.PrefaceText: My friend Sie Antry and I share the duty of keeping the monster population thinned out. But recently I feel that Sie's been shirking her duties. Perhaps she's overwhelmed. Can you visit her and see?
quest_13403.SuccessText:
Well, I'm glad she wasn't hurt or anything. Still, she'll have to listen to reason: I spend several days every week clearing the roads, and I've never seen her out there.

You don't suppose she works evenings while I work mornings, do you? Hah, no, that's the sort of misunderstanding you'd read in a bad adventure poem!

quest_13501.Description: Thimble Pete asked for a bunch of prepped cotton.
quest_13501.Name: Cotton Pickin'
quest_13501.PrefaceText: Oh, you look like the sort who works with their hands. Have you any cotton to spare? I could use some. Seeded and carded, of course.
quest_13501.SuccessText: Ah. Thank you. Here's something for your efforts!

quest_13502.Description: Thimble Pete asked for some fruit cocktail.
quest_13502.Name: Cocktails for Thimble Pete
quest_13502.PrefaceText: It gets so boring eating Hogan's cooking! What I wouldn't do for some fruit cocktail. Any kind would do, really. I'm not picky.
quest_13502.SuccessText: Why, thank you. That's fruit cocktail all right! And I guess I did say I didn't care what kind of fruit cocktail, didn't I? Me and my big mouth. Oh well, a favor's a favor! Here. This is for you.

quest_13503.Description: Thimble Pete asked for a Trophy Rat Skin, which is a rare item found by expert skinners.
quest_13503.Name: An Experiment Involving Rats
quest_13503.PrefaceText: I have a new idea for my fall line up! But I need something really crass to push it over the top. I know just the thing. Can you get me a really high-quality rat pelt? It'll make an amazingly awful hat.
quest_13503.SuccessText: Perfect! I'm not sure how this will become a hat just yet, but I'll think of something. Here, take this failed experiment.

quest_13601.Description: Malvol has asked you to obtain Basic Metal Slabs. These can be acquired with the Mining skill.
quest_13601.Name: Slabs for Malvol
quest_13601.PrefaceText: I need more basic metal slabs for my sword designs. Get me some.
quest_13601.SuccessText: Good work. Here, take this breastplate. It's inferior to mine, but I'm sure it's better than... whatever that thing is that you're wearing.

quest_13602.Description: Malvol has asked you to obtain Expert Volatile Ink.
quest_13602.Name: Malvol's Calligraphy Needs
quest_13602.PrefaceText: I ran out of volatile ink yesterday. Get me more. The good stuff, for experts, not whatever worthless ink you use!
quest_13602.SuccessText: Good work. Here, take these pants. They don't stink like your current ones do.

quest_13701.Description: Gorvessa hinted strongly that she would like some danablu cheese.
quest_13701.Name: Gorvessa's Cheesy Demand
quest_13701.PrefaceText: I heard there's a fancy cheese maker out in Eltibule somewhere! Could you find her? Make her give you some danablu. That's the best kind! And get some for me.
quest_13701.SuccessText: Mmm. Sweet and pungent. You are too kind! Here. Take this as a sort of gesture of thanks.

quest_13702.Description: Gorvessa is trying to create panther-themed lingerie and needs a Trophy Panther Skin. Or at least she thinks she does.
quest_13702.Name: The Sexy Panther
quest_13702.PrefaceText:
Sex with Malvol is getting old. And that's bad! It's my job to keep it interesting. But I'm really a shield-basher at heart. I'm no good at this.

I have an idea! I could make a sexy panther suit and pretend to hunt him. Hmm he may like that. But I'd need an extremely good panther skin.
quest_13702.SuccessText: Wow, this is larger than I expected! Thank you. Here, you can keep this skin -- it was my first idea, but turns out it's not sexy at all.

quest_13801.Description: Gretchen in Eltibule asked you to find a crate of gratflower millet. She thinks there's some left in the storage tower in Eltibule Keep.
quest_13801.Name: Gratflower Millet
quest_13801.PrefaceText:
I wish I'd had time to get all the supplies out of the keep before I left! Those squatters make it hard to get my stuff out of there now. I had a crate of gratflower millet in there, and I think it's still good! Could you go get it for me? It's in the front tower -- you'll walk under it as you enter the keep.

Oh, the wooden stairs to the towers were torn down, so you'll have to be a little creative.
quest_13801.SuccessText: This is the stuff! Thank you! I'll use this for my famous gratflower tongba. That will take a while to prepare, though. In the mean time, try this! It's another of my specialties.

quest_13802.Description: Gretchen in Eltibule complained about a lack of sour cream.
quest_13802.Name: Cream for Potatoes
quest_13802.PrefaceText: My main food is potatoes. I use other foods when I can get 'em, but potatoes are what get me through the long winters. Anyway, I fucking hate potatoes! At the very least, it'd be nice to have some sour cream, you know?
quest_13802.SuccessText: You got this for me? Well that's really kind of you! I was just complaining, I didn't mean to make you go to all that trouble. But I'm glad you did! Let me teach you some gardening tips. I wish I had more to offer!

quest_13803.Description: Gretchen in Eltibule has pined for an exotic spice, "muntok pepper". It's a common spice among orcs, so you might be able to find some in the Kur Mountains.
quest_13803.Name: Muntok Peppercorns
quest_13803.PrefaceText: When I was the chef for Lord Eltibule, he let me import all kinds of exotic spices! One that I used to love was muntok pepper. Hard to find it if you're not an orc, or insanely rich! But it makes the best spicy soups.
quest_13803.SuccessText: What... this is real muntok pepper! Why, you're a gem in the gold pile! Thank you so much! Let me give you some soup! No, no, that's not nearly good enough. Wait. Here, take this. I, uh, borrowed it when I was leaving the keep. It was the younger Lord Eltibule's hunting weapon. I thought I could use it for safety, but it's too fiddly for me.

quest_13901.Description: Percy in Eltibule encouraged you to kill Bear Groupies near The Mangler.
quest_13901.Name: Groupie Killing
quest_13901.PrefaceText: Seen them green bears out there? They're dangerous as hell, but don't bother killin' em, they're fey! They just come right back a week later! And so do those damned green panthers, must be fey too. But there are some ordinary bears that follow 'em around, charmed by their magic. Kill those ordinary bears and we can at least start to lower the danger!
