quest_13901.SuccessText:
Good job. Any little bit helps. Of course, the only way to really solve the problem is to go through the rift and kill them... that would have to kill 'em permanently, right?

Anyway, I bet ya used a bunch of arrows getting that done, huh? I have some spares for ya.

quest_13902.Description: Percy in Eltibule has asked for saltpeter. He intends to use it to blow up a portal.
quest_13902.Name: Saltpeter for Percy Evans
quest_13902.PrefaceText: Been thinking about the portal those green bears use to get back into our world. I'm gonna try blowin' it up! I know an old recipe for explosions... just need a bunch of saltpeter.
quest_13902.SuccessText:
Thanks! This will work. I'll try it out in a while.

I haven't got much, but here's some of my old emergency potions. You might as well use 'em, they're just going stale sitting on my shelf.

quest_13903.Description: Percy in Eltibule asked you to talk to a goblin named Jumjab on behalf of his dead wife. You'll need to know some Goblinese to do so.
quest_13903.MidwayText: Percy? Old human near the fairy bears? Ugh. Wants me to tell him his dead wife is "at peace." Tell him I'll come by, but it will cost him. I've sensed his wife's spirit. She's not "at peace." But I'll think of something to tell him...
quest_13903.Name: Lydia's Ghost
quest_13903.PrefaceText: There's this goblin off a long way from here. Met him? Named Jumjab. He says he can talk to dead people. I want him to visit here and tell me if he can sense my Lydia in the ground. I dunno why. Just... to know. Oh, you know goblinese, right?
quest_13903.SuccessText: Jumjab said he'd come, but expects payment? Well, of course. No goblin works for free. And you shouldn't have to, either. Here's some coin for your trouble.

quest_14001.Description: Flia has asked for a pair of antlers.
quest_14001.Name: New Spiky Headgear
quest_14001.PrefaceText: I have a deer friend who lost his antlers in a fight. He's very traumatized about it, even though I explained that they'd grow back. Can you get me a pair of replacement antlers?
quest_14001.SuccessText: Thanks. I hope you didn't have to kill too many deer for these! But I'm glad you understand that sometimes deer have to die for inexplicable reasons. That's part of nature's way.

quest_14002.Description: Flia has asked for a pair of cat eyeballs.
quest_14002.Name: The Cat's Glassy Stare
quest_14002.PrefaceText: I need some cat eyes for a special spell I'm working on! Can you get me some? Remember to kill the cats humanely. If you can.
quest_14002.SuccessText: Thank you. Culling cats just for their eyeballs may seem wasteful and stupid, but nature is often wasteful and stupid. You and I, we are one with nature.

quest_14003.Description: Flia has asked for a peridot.
quest_14003.Name: Peridots Needed
quest_14003.PrefaceText: Oh drat, I need more peridots to enhance my calligraphy. Do you happen to have a few?
quest_14003.SuccessText: Thanks! Let me give you something in exchange.

quest_14004.Description: Flia has asked for a large amount of Iocaine Powder.
quest_14004.Name: Flia's Odd Mushroom Request
quest_14004.PrefaceText: A poor transmogrified pigeon has been stopping by recently, begging for my help. Well, I can't help him, so I think it's time I put him down. Can you get me some Iocaine Powder? It's the most humane way.
quest_14004.SuccessText: Thank you! Would you like a snack? These are the unpoisoned ones, I promise! Tee hee!

quest_14101.Description: A goblin named Jumjab in Eltibule asked for some onions.
quest_14101.Name: Sachets of Onion Powder
quest_14101.PrefaceText: I use special fetish pouches when I commune with the dead. One of the ingredients is dried onion, and I'm out. I'll give you good money if you have some!
quest_14101.SuccessText: Good! These are indeed onions. Here is your money!

quest_14102.Description: A goblin named Jumjab in Eltibule asked for some perfectly round pebbles. He says there's no common place to find them, but they can be found "all over the place".
quest_14102.Name: Perfectly Round Pebbles
quest_14102.PrefaceText: I'm about to make another batch of fetish powder, and I'm out of pebbles! I need a couple of really smooth round pebbles. They help agitate the mixture while it's cooking. There's no easy place to find them, but they seem to pop up all over the place. Do you have any?
quest_14102.SuccessText: Thank you. It takes so long to collect these! Here, let me give you some Council money.

quest_14103.Description: A goblin named Jumjab in Eltibule asked for oversized mandibles, sometimes found on Tor-Uraks.
quest_14103.Name: Urak Mandibles
quest_14103.PrefaceText: I set up camp here so that I could kill the Tor-Uraks and take their mandibles. Sometimes you get a good, strong mandible from them, and those are precious to me! But it turns out Tor-Uraks are much, much too dangerous for me to kill. Do you have any mandibles, by chance?
quest_14103.SuccessText: You got them. I'm impressed! Here's some money! Oh, and here's a sample of one of the things I make with the mandibles.

quest_14201.Description: Yasinda in Hogan's Keep asked you to find proof that her daughter is dead. She said, "In the note, the sage told her to find his lean-to under a giant boulder. He said he could just hear the sounds of a waterfall."
quest_14201.Name: Finding Yasinda's Daughter
quest_14201.PrefaceText:
It's been almost a decade since I heard from my daughter. Last I heard she'd taken up with filthy human "sage" who promised to teach her secret human knowledge. Ha! Human knowledge! Anyway, the sage traveled here and then contacted Sinda and told her to come find him. I'm sure they're both dead by now. But I want to know. Please bring me proof of Sinda's death.

In the note, he told her to find his lean-to under a giant boulder. He said he could just hear the sounds of a waterfall.
quest_14201.SuccessText: Oh no. This is definitely Sinda's. Her father gave it to her, and I... I... need a moment. Thank you for your help. Here. It is customary to pay coins for services here, correct?

quest_14202.Description: Yasinda in Hogan's Keep asked you to find out if Sir Villas Wake has any children, so she can kill one to avenge her daughter's death. Villas Wake is dead, but she believes he may have left some personal belongings at Eltibule Keep.
quest_14202.Name: Kar-Get on Villas Wake

Objectives.Description: Find Personal Info about Villas Wake

quest_14202.PrefaceText:
Well, Sinda's dead. I blame that human that brought her to this horrible place. Unfortunately he has no mate to commit Kar-Get upon. Perhaps he has children. Find out for me. I am not an expert at combat, but I will have my vengeance.

I know that the human stayed at Eltibule Keep years ago, before the duke abandoned it. And like all human sages, he was a prolific journaler. Perhaps he left something there that would illuminate matters.
quest_14202.SuccessText: Ah, good. Let me see this. (Yasinda reads quickly, with intense concentration.) I see. He has a daughter in Statehelm. But he also seemed genuinely fond of Sinda. Argh! I wish I was first-generation; this would be so much easier without a conscience! Well. Thank you. I will contemplate my options. Here, take this ring back. As a gift for Sinda, I'd commissioned a spell to enhance the ring her father gave her. I went ahead and used the spell, figuring I could wear the ring myself, but it's too painful to keep. Please get rid of it for me.

quest_14203.Description: Yasinda in Hogan's Keep asked for some explosive ink.
quest_14203.Name: Explosive Ink for Yasinda
quest_14203.PrefaceText: I have decided not to take Kar-Get on Wake's daughter. It is right and just, but I would feel too guilty. Instead I will use my trade to honor her. I will make an explosive map, and give Sinda a symbolic burial by fire. Hm, I am out of explosive ink. Do you have any?
quest_14203.SuccessText: Thank you. I will perform the wake privately. I would invite you to join me, but I fear I may cry, and I will not be seen in that state. Oh, but here is some money to compensate for your purchase.

quest_15001.Description: Kleave has asked you for some leather strips.
quest_15001.Name: Strips
quest_15001.PrefaceText: Drat! Out of scrap pelts again! Can you run and get me some leather strips?
quest_15001.SuccessText: Thank you. Here, have some free tanning supplies.

quest_15002.Name: Power Potions!
quest_15002.PrefaceText: I have a long work order to get through today. I need refreshment! You've been down into the goblin basement, no? Do you have any power potions? The goblins love to carry them.
quest_15002.SuccessText: Thank you. I mix these with rhak whiskey for a truly energizing beverage. Here, let me show you a few pointers for your trouble.

quest_15003.Description: Kleave wants some low-value paintings. Paintings worth less than 50 councils would probably work best.
quest_15003.Name: Scrap Paintings
quest_15003.PrefaceText: Those goblins love artwork. I hate it! Bring me some of the lesser-valued pieces. I use them as floor coverings to keep my tanning chemicals from seeping into the groundwater.
quest_15003.SuccessText:
Yes, these will do. Thank you.

Here, let me show you how I mix the tannins. There's a trick to it, you see...

quest_15004.Description: Kleave has asked you to slay The Mauler and bring back his claw as proof.
quest_15004.Name: The Mauler

Objectives.Description: Kill The Mauler and Get His Claw

quest_15004.PrefaceText: North and east of here is a very powerful, semi-sentient fey bear named The Mauler. He and his mate dominate whole swaths of the countryside, maiming and killing any caravans that try to come here. Can you put him down? Bring me his claw when you've done the deed.
quest_15004.SuccessText: Yes, this is it! The very claw that nearly killed me. Who's laughing now, Mauler? I outlived you! Fool bear! (Kleave tosses the bloody paw over her shoulder.) Good work. Here. Let me show you a clever stitching technique.

quest_16001.Description: Sir Arif has asked for some venison.
quest_16001.Name: Deer In The Crypt
quest_16001.PrefaceText: I am so sick of Summoned Council Rations. Can you get me some fresh meat? How about ham? No! Venison!
quest_16001.SuccessText: Thanks! This is great! Here, in exchange, let me teach you some swordfighting pointers.

quest_16002.Description: Sir Arif has asked you to kill the dinosaurs that roam the crypt.
quest_16002.Name: Damned Dinosaurs
quest_16002.PrefaceText: So we accidentally summoned a portal to an area infested with dinosaurs. And now this tomb is crawling with them! I've cleared out a bunch from this area, but can you hunt down some more?
quest_16002.SuccessText: Thanks! Here, take this. It's not much, but it's a token.

quest_16003.Description: Sir Arif wants you to kill Ursula and bring her creepy stuffed bear as proof.
quest_16003.Name: Ursula's Creepy Bear
quest_16003.PrefaceText:
Lady Rasheen was a fellow engineer with a whole lot more experience fixing portals. I wish she was here now, but she was killed by her own curiosity. She opened the tomb nearby and a skeleton climbed into her mind. Said the only way to cure it was to kill the skeleton, but we weren't strong enough. She died blubbering in the corner about how children were throwing fire at her. Very sad.

Anyway! Can you go kill that thing? She has a plush toy  bring it to me as evidence.
quest_16003.SuccessText: That's it! I guess that's the last we'll see of her! Hah, who am I kidding, this is an emotion resonance chamber down here, the undead are just rising back up out of the ground continuously. Unless we can get a squad of Placid Seers down here to wipe everything out, I give her a month, two tops before she's right back at it. So you pretty much wasted your time. But I appreciate the effort! Here's something for your trouble.

quest_16101.Description: A monstrosity named Yalox asked you for a really good bandage.
quest_16101.Name: Bandage The Soul

Objectives.Description: Obtain an Expert's First Aid Kit

quest_16101.PrefaceText: Davlos gave us healing! The power to heal! But magical healing cannot stop the pain! I need mundane healing! Bring it to me!
quest_16101.SuccessText: Yes. Yalox eats the bandage. It does nothing! NOTHING!

quest_16102.Description: A monstrosity named Yalox asked you to just kill some goblins as some sort of pointless revenge.
quest_16102.Name: Goblin Genocide
quest_16102.PrefaceText: We were sent here by Davlos to find ancient Dwarf treasure. There are no Dwarves! Only goblins! And they enslave us with promises of healing. They lie! Kill them! Vindicate us!
quest_16102.SuccessText: Ha ha ha ha! Now the pain... is still here! It's not gone! No! Noooo!

quest_16201.Description: A rakshasa named Zealo asked you to collect mana sponges that she placed in jars all through the area.
quest_16201.Name: Mana Sponges
quest_16201.PrefaceText: Can you go collect my mana sponges? They're in jars all through the area. If you bring me six, you can keep any others you find. And I'll teach you a recipe that uses them.
quest_16201.SuccessText: Thanks. Let me teach you a recipe that uses these!

quest_16202.Description: A rakshasa named Zealo asked you to collect toxic sludge for her potions.
quest_16202.Name: Sludge!
quest_16202.PrefaceText: The mantises have been augmenting the oozes in here, making them more dangerous. Morons! But there's a silver lining: their mucus is very useful for potions. If you happen to kill some oozes, can you look for their sludge?
quest_16202.SuccessText: Ugh. This stuff is gross. Thanks, though. I use it for everything from potions to food seasoning. Hm? Oh, a reward? Uh... here. This is... valuable, maybe?

quest_17001.Description: Therese has asked for bone meal. She thinks it's most easily obtained in the crypt at the back of the small graveyard beneath Serbule.
quest_17001.Name: Bone Meal
quest_17001.PrefaceText:
Hmm, running low on bone meal! Can you get me some more? The easiest way to get it is to rob tombs. Oh, it's okay, they aren't using it!

Try the crypt at the back of the graveyard outside of town. It'll be in a ways, since dumb old Marna already excavated all the easily-reached bone meal.
quest_17001.SuccessText:
Perfect! Thanks! You're good at this fetching stuff!

Let me show you a couple little gardening tips.

quest_17002.Description: Therese has asked for some hash browns.
quest_17002.Name: Therese Wants Hash Browns
quest_17002.PrefaceText:
You know what I could go for? Some venison hash browns! But it's a secret family recipe. I guess regular old hash browns would do, too.

If you happen to be cooking, could you fry me up some Hash Browns? Don't go to any trouble on my account, though.
quest_17002.SuccessText:
Mmm, smells delicious! Thanks!

Let me show you a couple little gardening tips.

quest_17003.Description: Therese has asked for some dinosaur scales. She thinks there are dinosaurs living deep in the crypt beneath Serbule.
quest_17003.Name: Dinosaur Scales For Therese
quest_17003.PrefaceText:
I've been working on a new fertilizer using some dinosaur scales I had delivered from Statehelm. It's not working yet, but I think I'm getting closer! But I need more scales.

Say, I heard someone say there were dinosaurs in the crypt! You know, the crypt at the back of the graveyard? I only ever saw horrible spiders, but I didn't go in very far. Could you look?
quest_17003.SuccessText: Perfect! Scaly! I'm going to turn them into powder and try to grow things with them. Wish me luck! Oh, here, let me show you a handy gardening trick.

quest_18001.Description: Marna asked you for some lapis lazuli.
quest_18001.Name: Lapis Lazuli for Marna
quest_18001.PrefaceText: You know how every kind of crystal has certain magical attunements? Well, lapis lazuli is attuned to alchemy. It has many uses for empowering potions. And I'm fresh out. Get me some?
quest_18001.SuccessText: Perfect! Let me give you something in return. Hmm, I know, here: take my stash. I've sworn off the stuff. But it's great when you need a little extra kick. Just don't get hooked on it, okay? It can really mess you up.

quest_19001.Description: Tadion wants some firewood to keep his forge hot.
quest_19001.Name: Lumber for the Forge
quest_19001.PrefaceText:
I know Velkort thinks I should be able to keep the forge hot through my magic, but I'm afraid I was never very good at it. Hammering's more my thing.

Can you get me some non-magical fuel for my fire? I'm running low.
quest_19001.SuccessText: Thanks! That's perfect. Here, let me give you some cash for that.

quest_19002.Description: Tadion needs some metal slabs for his current project.
quest_19002.Name: Metal Slabs
quest_19002.PrefaceText: Blacksmithing is all about shaping metal. But we've been a little low on metal for a while now. I mean, there's not exactly an iron mine nearby. I generally make do, but I wouldn't mind some spare metal, that's for sure!
quest_19002.SuccessText: You're good. Not great, but good. I respect that. Greatness is overrated. Here. Take some money.

quest_19003.Name: Ivory Horn
quest_19003.PrefaceText: I'm making a special ... device. For Ivyn. It's a ... well, anyway, it doesn't matter. I need a horn. A really nice one, maybe made of ivory? Or something even better if you come across it. Thanks.
quest_19003.SuccessText: You found one?! Wow. Thanks! Here's some cash for your trouble.

quest_20001.Description: Landri in the Kur Mountains asked for Ice Cores.
quest_20001.Name: Ice Cores for Landri the Cold
quest_20001.PrefaceText: I need more Ice Cores to research better cold spells. Do you happen to have any?
quest_20001.SuccessText: Thank you! Here's something for your trouble. If you find more, come back in a week. I'm sure I'll need more soon enough.

quest_20002.Description: Landri in the Kur Mountains asked you to cull the Fire Sheep that have been recently appearing up in Kur.
quest_20002.Name: Anomalous Fire Sheep

Objectives.Description: Kill Fire Sheep in Kur Mountains

quest_20002.PrefaceText: Have you seen those damned sheep that are always on fire? It's genetic, apparently. Some insane wizard did something to them and let fire sheep loose on the land. A stray fire sheep must have made its way here and started mating with the local population. Unfortunately it's dominant, so we need to cull these before it gets too widespread.
quest_20002.SuccessText: Good, good. Wizards have a bad enough reputation without passersby dying from sheep explosions. Here, maybe this old staff will be of use to you.

quest_20003.Description: Landri in the Kur Mountains asked for Saltpeter.
quest_20003.Name: Saltpeter for Landri the Cold
quest_20003.PrefaceText: I know it's quite rare, but I might as well ask: have you stumbled on any extra saltpeter? I'm trying to master a few fire spells I missed. Just for completeness' sake, you understand.
quest_20003.SuccessText: Perfect! Thank you. Here, take a few of these.

quest_20101.Description: Ukorga in the Kur Mountains asked you for Tufts of Fur.
quest_20101.Name: Ukorga's Fur Order
quest_20101.PrefaceText: I'm trying to fill this order for fur-lined coats. I don't get many orders, you know? Pretty satisfying knowing my reputation's getting around. Trouble is, I'm out of fur to finish the last one. Can you get me some?
quest_20101.SuccessText: Thanks! Uh, here, take these as trade.

quest_20102.Description: Ukorga in the Kur Mountains asked you for Cedar Wood Chips to keep the kitchen stocked.
quest_20102.Name: Keep the Kitchen Stocked
quest_20102.PrefaceText:
I didn't lay in enough cedar wood chips for all the cooking that Laura's been doing. She brings in lots of customers and I don't want her to get upset!

I have plenty of maple wood, but she only uses cedar for cooking. Can you get some more?
quest_20102.SuccessText: Perfect! You're the best! Here, take this old thing. It looks good on you!

quest_20103.Description: Ukorga in the Kur Mountains asked you for Wool.
quest_20103.Name: Wool Supply
quest_20103.PrefaceText: Hey can you go get some wool off the mountain sheep? Don't bother trying to shear them, they'll just kick your ass. You have to take 'em out. All the docile sheep live in pleasant territory. The sheep here are all assholes.
quest_20103.SuccessText: Thanks, that's plenty. Got lots more pairs of pants to insulate! Here, take this.

quest_20104.Description: Ukorga in the Kur Mountains asked you to procure some nice chairs.
quest_20104.Name: Better Chairs
quest_20104.PrefaceText: Nobody likes sitting on the stools in here. I wish I had better chairs. Real nice ones! But I don't know how to make those.
quest_20104.SuccessText: You did it, thank you! I'll just take these into the back and let them sit for a few days while I pretend to make them. No offense, I just have to keep up appearances! But here. This is something I did make.

quest_20105.Description: Ukorga in the Kur Mountains asked you for lots of Trophy Wolf Skins.
quest_20105.Name: Trophy Wolves
quest_20105.PrefaceText: I've been making these crazy wolf-hood hats, right? And they're really popular. But I haven't got any more wolf pelts. Whenever I try to skin them, it doesn't come out right. Are you good at skinning wolves? Care to help me out? I'll pay handsomely.
quest_20105.SuccessText: Thanks! Perfect! You're really good at skinning wolves. Here, let me pay you for those. And let me show you a couple of leatherworking pointers, too!

quest_20106.Description: Ukorga asked you to collect some Unrefined Silver Ore.
quest_20106.Name: Silver Ore for Swords
quest_20106.PrefaceText: Hey, you any good at mining? There's silver ore out there in the lowlands, just waiting to be mined! But I don't know how to do that part. I can smelt it, though. Tell you what, bring me some, and I'll give you one of my special silvered swords.
quest_20106.SuccessText: That's the stuff. Here's your sword, hope you like it!

quest_20201.Description: Jace Soral in the Kur Mountains asked you to kill nearby deer to reduce the predator food supply.
quest_20201.Name: Thin The Food Supply
quest_20201.PrefaceText: So here's the thing: nature takes care of itself, usually. But when fifty werewolves show up, not so much. The prey is so abundant that they're mating like crazy. Let's try to work smarter: try killing a bunch of deer so they can't eat 'em. That's smart, right? Or is it stupid? Hmm.
quest_20201.SuccessText: Good. Now we wait a year and see how many werewolves are born! Damn. Yeah, this was a stupid plan. Nevermind. Take these shoes and let's pretend this never happened.

quest_20202.Description: Jace Soral in the Kur Mountains asked you to collect a bunch of Wolfsbane.
quest_20202.Name: Wolfsbane Needed
quest_20202.PrefaceText: Wolfsbane is this horrible poisonous flower that grows in the winter months. You should be able to find some around here. It's good for killin' wolves... and werewolves. There's a lot of ways to use it, and I'll show you one technique if you get me some.
quest_20202.SuccessText: Yep, this is the shit. Okay, so here's what you do. You take a mushroom bomb, see, and...

quest_20203.Description: Jace Soral in the Kur Mountains asked you for wool
quest_20203.Name: Wooly Needs
quest_20203.PrefaceText: Can you go down into the lowlands below the forest and kill some of those idiot sheep for wool? I'm trying to make better equipment since apparently we're gonna be stuck here a while...
quest_20203.SuccessText: Thanks! Here, this is for you.

quest_20301.Description: Sanja in the Kul Mountains asked you to kill the mindless werewolves in the forest.
quest_20301.Name: Werewolves
quest_20301.PrefaceText: A favor for me? Help me finish my objective here: kill all these mindless werewolves!
quest_20301.SuccessText: That helped. Not enough, but a start. Thank you. I don't have much, but here's some coin.

quest_20302.Description: Sanja in the Kul Mountains asked you to bring her some raw venison.
quest_20302.Name: Deer Meat
quest_20302.PrefaceText: I hunger. I should go kill deer... but I need to stay here for a bit longer. Can you bring me a few carcasses?
quest_20302.SuccessText: Thank you. Do you use potions? I don't, but Jace brought a supply for me anyway. Here, take this.

quest_20303.Description: Sanja in the Kul Mountains asked you to ruthlessly kill some mountain bears in her name.
quest_20303.Name: Bear Massacre
quest_20303.PrefaceText: Those bears attack even stronger predators! They need to be shown their place. But I don't dare waver in my goal. You, however, might be able to waver a little bit? Just a tad? Make them suffer.
quest_20303.SuccessText: Yes. Good! Do you like swords when in your other form? Here, take this spare.

quest_20304.Description: Sanja in the Kul Mountains asked you to find magic teeth from werewolves. They apparently are rather rare.
quest_20304.Name: Magic Teeth
quest_20304.PrefaceText: Werewolves who never leave wolf form eventually start leaking magic into their bones and organs. It's happened to me, and I quite like the feeling, but I wish to study the phenomenon more... without dissecting myself. See if you can find werewolves whose magic has bled into their teeth. I doubt they'll be too common, but please look around.
quest_20304.SuccessText: Ah, yes! I'll grind them to powder and see what I can figure out. Thank you. Here: a less-useful powder, but some mages like it.

quest_15.Name: Find Bones
quest_15.PrefaceText: Hey, you've been killing those damned skeletons, right? Got any good, strong femurs? I need a half-dozen for this project I'm working on.
quest_15.SuccessText: Thanks, these will work great for my marionettes!

quest_20401.Name: Find Spoons
quest_20401.PrefaceText: I thought I saw some spoons lying around here somewhere. They could be anywhere in these caves, though. Can you see if you can a couple? I want to use them in my art.
quest_20401.SuccessText: Thanks! These will be the faces of my marionettes! Here, want this pretty stone I found?

quest_20501.Description: Lamashu has asked for some oak wood.
quest_20501.Name: Lamashu Wants Lumber
quest_20501.PrefaceText: There's lots of good cedar here, and a little bit of maple, but no oak. You wouldn't happen to have oak wood with you, by chance?
quest_20501.SuccessText: Thanks! Let me show you a clever way to prepare oak planks. [You gain Carpentry XP.]

quest_20502.Description: Lamashu has asked for some meditation stools.
quest_20502.Name: Stool Order
quest_20502.PrefaceText: That drunkard Ukorga asked me to make him some meditation stools to decorate his inn. That'd be a waste of time. I need to focus on honing my skills! But I already told him I'd do it. Can I delegate that task to you?
quest_20502.SuccessText: Hmm, yep, these are decent, thanks! I'll give you the money Ukorga promised me for these stools.

quest_20601.Description: Gurki asked you for some Advanced Reservoir Arrows
quest_20601.Name: Arrows for the Occasion
quest_20601.PrefaceText: Shadow Keepers are lookin' for me. But they don't come up here, since it's a worthless hell hole. But if they do, I'm ready with my bow... except I'm out of arrows. Can you get me some good arrows for shootin' poison?
quest_20601.SuccessText: These will work. Thanks. Here's some coin. don't expect to survive a fight with the Shadow Keepers, but I don't want to make it too easy, either.

quest_20602.Description: Gurki asked you for some Floral Soap.
quest_20602.Name: Smelly Gurki
quest_20602.PrefaceText: Ugh, I stink. I know it, you don't have to make that face! Ain't bathed in days. Ukorga's out of soap again. What a moron. You got any soap by chance?
quest_20602.SuccessText: Great. Now get lost so I can bathe. Here's some cash for your trouble.

quest_20603.Description: Gurki asked you to obtain some unrefined silver ore.
quest_20603.Name: Gurki Wants Silver
quest_20603.PrefaceText: Been working on a new tailoring technique where I inlay the cloth with silver. But I ain't got no silver left. Get me some?
quest_20603.SuccessText: Yep, that's the stuff. Here, take this. It was my first attempt, but I think I can do better.

quest_20604.Description: Gurki asked you for a Nice Calligraphy Bench
quest_20604.Name: A Bench For Writing
quest_20604.PrefaceText: Been drawing up new tailoring plans. Gotta keep my mind off the Shadow Keepers! But it's a bitch to draw anything in this frozen hellhole. What I wouldn't do for a nice calligraphy bench!
quest_20604.SuccessText: Wow, I didn't expect you to manage that. Thank you. Ain't got much to repay you with, but here's some tailoring supplies.

quest_20701.Description: Ratuk the Thinker asked for tundra lichen, which he believes grows in Kur.
quest_20701.Name: Lichens for Research
quest_20701.PrefaceText: The reason I'm here in Kur is the tundra lichen. They grow here, though I've not found very many. I need more tundra lichen for my research. If you see any, I will pay handsomely.
quest_20701.SuccessText:
Yes. This is the lichen. Thank you. With this acting as a power chamber, I should be able to break the dimensional barrier and discover entire new worlds of existence. But I need a lot more research to test my theory.

Sorry, I didn't mean to ramble. Here, take some coin for your work.

quest_20702.Description: Ratuk the Thinker asked you to deliver a note to an elf named Landri the Cold. He said Landri was in an inn somewhere in Kur Mountains.
quest_20702.MidwayText: What's this? Landri takes the letter and reads it with incredible speed. Hm. A valid hypothesis, though I do not think it will work. Tell the author that she should substitute other elemental energy foci in place of ice foci. I believe that all the elemental planes are very close together, and using other energy types will open micro-portals to those planes, which may coalesce into a full portal more easily. And tell her good luck; she will need it.
quest_20702.Name: Ice Plane Research

Objectives.Description: Deliver a note to Landri the Cold

quest_20702.PrefaceText: There is a disgraced Ice Magus staying in that little inn on the mainland. Her theorycrafting is already spreading among outsiders, but her own society has vilified her, just for a single murder. Elven society is foolish. But no matter: I must take advantage of this opportunity. Unfortunately because of their rampant racism, I cannot walk into the inn and have a conversation. I would be attacked. Instead, please deliver this note for me.
quest_20702.SuccessText: You relay Landri the Cold's words. Thank you. Her theory is plausible. I will try my method first, but if it doesn't work, I'll try hers.

quest_20703.Description: You've been asked to obtain Fulgurites for Ratuk the Thinker.
quest_20703.Name: The Lightning Connection
quest_20703.PrefaceText: My experiments have proven fruitless. Landri's idea seems more compelling. But sadly I don't have any electricity power sources. Can you get me some? Fulgurite will do. Just look for creatures that inherently give off lightning. ... Admittedly there are probably none of those in Kur, but, well, if you end up travelling elsewhere... keep it in mind.

quest_20704.Description: Ratuk the Thinker asked for some orcish spell pouches, which can occasionally be found on orcish wizards.
quest_20704.Name: Killing Kin
quest_20704.PrefaceText: I have a ... delicate request to make. You see, my spell pouch is depleted, and I cannot take the time to travel all the way home to replenish it. But there are other orcish wizards in the area, and some of them have spell pouches. Could you choose some of the stupider ones and kill them for their pouches? Make it look like an accident, if you can.
quest_20704.SuccessText: Hmm. Well these are low on sulfur, but they will do. Thank you, my friend. We shall not speak of this again, but when the time comes, I will remember who my friends are.

quest_20801.Description: Nelson Ballard in Serbule has asked you to obtain some cheese he ordered from a man in Eltibule Keep.
quest_20801.MidwayText: Oh, yes, the Veltan Blue for Mr. Ballard. Um. Well... The reason I haven't delivered it yet is because it isn't ready yet. He does understand that a custom blue cheese will take time to ripen, right? Obviously not. Tell him that I will bring him his cheese as soon as it is perfect, and not a moment before!
quest_20801.Name: Cheese Run
quest_20801.PrefaceText: Well if you're heading all the way out to Eltibule, could you stop by the keep and pick up my cheese from an Elf named Braigon? I need it right away, and I think he forgot about me.
quest_20801.SuccessText:
What? Not ready? It's been weeks! Cheese-making is so stupid.

I just wanted the Velten Blue because it was my wife's favorite, and tomorrow would have been our anniversary. I don't even like it!

You know what? Go tell him to cancel the order. No, no, don't do that. I already paid for the stuff. I'll just give it away when it finally arrives.

Thank-you. Here's a few coin for your trouble.

quest_20802.Description: Nelson Ballard asked you to deliver a Praetor's Order to a shady potion seller living in a tent outside of town.
quest_20802.MidwayText: What? A Praetor's Order? He seriously wants to issue a Praetor's Execution out here? In front of those Elves? What would they think? They'd revolt! No, he's just bluffing. Tell him I'm not going anywhere!
quest_20802.Name: The Trespassing Charlatan
quest_20802.PrefaceText: There was a charlatan visiting town a couple days ago. Well, his potions are magical, but Velkort said they were incredibly toxic. I ordered him to leave Serbule, but I hear he's still around somewhere, selling potions out of his tent. So now I have to make it official. Can you deliver this? It's a Praetor's Order, declaring him illegal in this area.
quest_20802.SuccessText:
He said he won't leave? Damn it. He's called my bluff: the only way to enforce a Praetor's Order is through execution. I could have an execution squad teleported in to dispatch him, but that would be a bit much for simple trespassing! Hm. Well, I'll think of something to get rid of him.

Thanks for helping with these errands! Here, you look handy with a sword, do you want this? It's my old backup blade. Maybe you'll find it useful.

quest_20803.Description: Nelson Ballard asked you to be on the lookout for a super-intelligent rat. If found, Nelson needs the rat's head decoration -- some sort of tiara or headband.
quest_20803.Name: The Rat Tiara
quest_20803.PrefaceText:
The nonsense I have to deal with. An Elf in town recently reported a theft of his magic headband. But get this: he said a super-intelligent rat stole it from him in the dead of night. Clearly more is going on here, but he won't say anything else.

And the frustrating part about this idiotic story is that I believe him! So, if you're travelling in the woods outside of town and you come across a super-intelligent rat with a tiara or something, can you bring it to me? I need to get to the bottom of this, and I think that head thing will be a useful bargaining chip.
quest_20803.SuccessText: This is it? This is the thing Echur wanted back? Huh. Well, thanks! Here, let me reward you. I don't have a lot of cash, but here's a Council Note.

quest_20901.Description: Nightshade asked you to look in on his friend Syndra, who is residing somewhere in a barn in Kur Mountains. In return, Nightshade says he'll help you convince Syndra to teach you her unusual craft skill.
quest_20901.MidwayText: Huh? Nightshade sent you? Really? Well... tell him thanks. I'm okay. Just... cold and miserable.
quest_20901.Name: Check In On Syndra
quest_20901.PrefaceText:
The easiest of my friends to find would probably be Syndra. She's in this frozen hell-hole somewhere. She said she'd found a shack or a barn or something, and it had a magical fire to keep her warm. That's all I know. But it's out there somewhere!

Find her, report back to me, and I'll help you convince her to train you in her special craft skill.
quest_20901.SuccessText: You found her and she's okay? Great! Are you a crafter? If so, I bet she'd be happy to teach you her craft. Tell her I vouch for you. If she needs proof, tell her you know her old guild nickname: "Frisky Ferret".

quest_20902.Description: Nightshade asked you to look in on his friend Malgath, who is deep within a cave full of wolves. The cave is somewhere in the Kur Mountains. In return, Nightshade says he'll help you convince Malgath to teach you his unusual craft skill.
quest_20902.MidwayText: Nightshade sent you? Well, at least he didn't come after me himself. He'd die! Tell him I'm fine. I'm just infected with lycanthropy. I'm a werewolf now. I've just got to get this under control, and if I succeed, I'll come find him.
quest_20902.Name: Check In On Malgath
quest_20902.PrefaceText: Malgath was staying here with us at first, but one day he came back from hunting and said he was "infected". Said he had to go take care of his infection, and he moved into a cave not too far from here. I went to check on him a week ago, and the cave is full of wolves! Couldn't get very far in there. I guess he's dead... but if you find him in there, let me know. If he's still alive, I'll help you convince him to train you.
quest_20902.SuccessText: Malgath caught lycanthropy from a wolf?! What a moron! That's sexually transmitted, right? So he just went out and humped a wolf in the woods?! I didn't think rakkies went for that sort of... what? Oh. Transmitted through bites? So any of the wolves out there could be infected? Well, that's terrifying! I guess we just wait and see if Malgath retains his sanity. Hmm, are you a crafter by trade? If so, maybe you should go learn anything he's willing to teach you... while he's still sane. If he's reluctant to train you, tell him Nightshade is calling in a favor.

quest_20903.Description: Nightshade asked you to look in on his business associate Gribburn, a goblin who lives within Hogan's Keep in Eltibule. In return, Nightshade says he'll help you convince Gribburn to teach you his unusual craft skill.
quest_20903.MidwayText: Ah, Nightshade, I'd forgotten about him. He was a good business partner, but then he went and got a guild of human assassins after him. Tell him that his concern is appreciated, but misplaced. We've both moved on. I'm going to stay here: free food and a bed, and nobody's trying to kill me!
quest_20903.Name: Check In On Gribburn
quest_20903.PrefaceText:
You aren't racist, are you? The next one's a goblin. Don't kill him! He's the best helm-enchanter I know! Not exactly a friend, but he's friendly as far as goblins go. He went to visit his old "tribe", and ended up moving into some castle.

I'm worried he's doing stuff that will get him killed. You know, normal goblin stuff. Go see how he is. He's staying in a place called "Hogan's Keep". It's somewhere in Eltibule.

In return, I'll help you convince the little bastard to train you in his secretive craft skill.
quest_20903.SuccessText:
I'm glad Gribburn hasn't gotten himself killed by an overzealous human. It sounds like he's found a sweet setup for himself, too!

But if he's going to live in some castle, that means I need more people who know how to do what he does. Say... are you a crafter? Why don't you learn his techniques? If he refuses to teach you, tell him that I'll have him killed! He'll think that's a hilariously bad bluff, and his levity will give you an opening to negotiate.

It'll work. Goblins are incredibly predictable. Trust me.

quest_20904.Description: Nightshade asked you to look in on his friend Poe, a myconian who lives somewhere beneath Serbule. In return, Nightshade says he'll help you convince Poe to teach you his unusual craft skill.
quest_20904.MidwayText: Nightshade? Oh, the overworlder that named itself after a plant. I remember. I like Nightshade. Tell Nightshade that I am well, and that I am grateful for the concern.
quest_20904.Name: Check In On Poe
quest_20904.PrefaceText:
Well, I'll tell you about Poe, but I don't expect you'll be able to find him. He's a myconian. A mushroom man! Weirdest thing I've ever seen wield a jeweler's hammer, I assure you! He was never part of our guild, but we invited him to come with us anyway. Sadly, he refused: he hates the cold. Can't blame him. He said he was going home, "under the ground in Serbule." So I guess you go there and start digging? How big is Serbule anyway?

Do this for me, and I'll put in a good word with you to Poe!
quest_20904.SuccessText:
You found Poe! I'm glad he's alive. How many oils did he send back with you? ... None at all?! You went all that way and got nothing for me?!

No, no, I'm not angry. I'm just very disappointed. Hm. Why don't you go back and ask him to teach you his techniques? I bet you'd be a faster crafter than a myconian could ever be!

quest_21001.Description: Syndra in Kur Mountains has asked for some wood for her fire. Any wood will do.
quest_21001.Name: So... Cold...
quest_21001.PrefaceText: I thought this stupid magic fire would keep me warm, but it keeps shutting out! I guess I need to put firewood in it. Like a savage. But I'm too cold to go looking for wood... could you bring me some?
quest_21001.SuccessText: Thanks! This will keep me warm for a little while. I appreciate it! I don't have much to give you in exchange, but here's a few coins.

quest_21002.Description: Syndra in Kur Mountains asked for a trophy sheep skin.
quest_21002.Name: Ultimate Woolly Comfort
quest_21002.PrefaceText: Making armor isn't really my main thing, but I'm not terrible at it. I wish I had one of those big sheep skins -- a perfect one, a flawless one. I could make a really cozy jacket!
quest_21002.SuccessText: Oh, wow. This will work great! I'm going to get started right now. Here... would you like my old coat? It's pretty warm.

quest_21003.Description: Syndra in Kur Mountains wishes she had some dragon scales to take home with her.
quest_21003.Name: Scales of a Dragon!
quest_21003.PrefaceText: Back in Sinoca I had a state of the art research laboratory for inventing new augmentation oils. I had a breakthrough design that requires dragon scales, but, of course... I could never find any dragon scales! Wouldn't it be great if I found some dragon scales to take home with me? It'd almost make this experience worthwhile. Uh... do you know where any already-dead dragons are? ... Me neither.
quest_21003.SuccessText: Oh my goodness. You're too much! You found a dead dragon and pried off its scales for me?! Thank you so much! I hope it wasn't too scary. Even if it was long-dead I'd be a little scared of such a fearsome monster. I wish I had something to offer you... hm, here. This is... a thing!

quest_21101.Description: Malgath in the werewolf den asked you to obtain some wolfsbane for him.
quest_21101.Name: Anti-Lycanthropy Potion
quest_21101.PrefaceText: I was once a professional alchemist, and I'm certain there's a formula that will help me keep my sanity when the full moon comes. The secret is those horrible flowers that grow out in the snow: wolfsbane. But it's hard for me to pick them, because they're very toxic to me now. Can you get some for me?
quest_21101.SuccessText: Augh! Irhetsu bless my nose! The stench of those flowers! Haha, the secret has to be locked in these! Thank you. Here. This was one of my demonstration weapons when I used to sell weapons door to door.

quest_21102.Description: Malgath in the werewolf den asked you to obtain orange juice.
quest_21102.Name: Orange Juice for Malgath
quest_21102.PrefaceText: For my alchemical experiments, I need a liquid that's sweet and full of citric acid. Orange juice should work. But, of course, this is Kur! No oranges for thousands of miles! What should I do?
quest_21102.SuccessText: You got orange juice! But how? You're quite adroit at obtaining unusual things, aren't you? Here. I'll trade you for a few of these unusual coins I found lying around the cave.

quest_21103.Description: Malgath in the werewolf den needs "worm teeth" from Tor-Uraks. It would take a skilled butcher to get the tooth out in one piece, though!
quest_21103.Name: Worm Teeth
quest_21103.PrefaceText:
I need an injector that can go through my wolfen skin when I change form. It needs to be as sharp as a knife, but hollow for my potion to flow through.

And I know just the thing: the teeth of the Tor-Urak would work! And there's a bunch out in Kur. Of course, I'd need to kill a bunch of Tor-Uraks and then carefully butcher them to try to find a viable tooth... that seems unlikely in my current state. Unless you can help?
quest_21103.SuccessText: You got them! Wow, these are larger and sharper than I expected. Intimidated? No! No. ... I'm just scared. It's not the same. Here. Take these coins for your trouble.

quest_21201.Description: Gribburn in Hogan's Keep asked you for a goblin hairpin.
quest_21201.Name: Gribburn's Hair Pin
quest_21201.PrefaceText: See Gorvessa over there? She's pretty amazing, huh? And I hear she's only 'temporarily' Malvol's consort. Which means I have a chance! I need a gift, though. Can you get me a goblin hairpin? I'll imbue it with magic and impress her.
quest_21201.SuccessText: This will do. Thank you. Now go! Don't let Gorvessa saw you giving it to me! I need her to think I crafted it for her. Here, just take some money and shut up about this!

quest_21202.Description: Gribburn in Hogan's Keep asked you for some eel kabobs.
quest_21202.Name: Gribburn Wants Eel Kabobs
quest_21202.PrefaceText: Gorvessa is beautiful, but her cooking is... well, it's adequate. But my refined palate needs something better. I could really go for eel kabobs right now!
quest_21202.SuccessText: Mmm. Thanks! All mine, no sharing! Here, you can have the meal Gorvessa made for me.

quest_21203.Description: Gribburn in Hogan's Keep asked you for a bunch of long rubbery tongues from Ranalan Warriors. A tribe of them live in far-off Sun Vale, among other places.
quest_21203.Name: Tongues for Shoes
quest_21203.PrefaceText: So I was enchanting Ultashk's boots, and he mentioned that they keep slipping around on his foot. This is a common goblin problem because our armor is crafted by slaves with low morale. But I think I can fix it! I just need some ranalan flesh! You know, the frog people? They're super rubbery and gross. I think I could dry out their tongues and use them as foot padding. Can you get some for me?
quest_21203.SuccessText: Ewww, so gross! Hahaha! Good job. Here. These shoes are too big for goblins: no amount of padding will save them! But they might fit you.

quest_21301.Description: Poe the Myconian asked you to retrieve some blusher mushrooms. Poe will use them to inhibit premature sporing.
quest_21301.Name: Inhibiting the Sporing
quest_21301.PrefaceText: I am young for my kind, but I am already sporing! My adventures into the overworld have caused me to bloom prematurely. I am not ready to clone myself, so I must delay the sporing. Do you have some of the inhibitor medicine? Your kind calls it 'Blusher Mushrooms'. I need much of it.
quest_21301.SuccessText: I am grateful. These will prohibit my sporing for several more seasons so that I may have further adventures in the overworld. Would you like these? They are but toys to my kind, but dangerous weapons to your kind.

quest_21302.Description: Poe the Myconian asked you to retrieve some ectoplasm. It can often be found on ghosts.
quest_21302.Name: The Secret Ingredient
quest_21302.PrefaceText: My special art requires a very uncommon ingredient. In fact, it is so rare that I have never obtained it directly myself; I have only ever received it from others. Can you fulfill this role now? I require ectoplasm. It is the give-off of ghosts, banshees, wailing spirits, and other incorporeal former-meatlings.
quest_21302.SuccessText: This is a valuable gift. Thank you. I wish for you to have this in exchange.

quest_21303.Description: Poe the Myconian asked for a bunch of unrefined gold ore.
quest_21303.Name: Gold Ore For Poe
quest_21303.PrefaceText: I must ask you again for aid in preparing my special augments. I will need many such items to fund my travels. Gold works well for creating the augments. Unrefined gold ore is best. I've noticed that overworlders often keep gold on hand. Do you happen to have any?
quest_21303.SuccessText: Thank you for sharing your overworlder wealth with me. In exchange, I shall share knowledge with you. [ You gain Jewelry Augment Brewing XP ]

quest_22001.Description: Mu the Myconian asked you to collect the heartshrooms of any Myconians you're forced to kill.
quest_22001.Name: Heartshrooms
quest_22001.PrefaceText: If you travel in these caves you will meet violent myconians. Either you or they shall die. If it is they who die, please bring back any intact heartshrooms you find. We can regrow myconians from them.
quest_22001.SuccessText: Thank you. We will regenerate these myconians and retrain them. It will take several years, but if you return I will make sure they thank you for saving them. [You gain Myconic XP.]

quest_22002.Description: Mu asked you to locate Poe, a myconian that may not entirely be under Tidal's influence, and deliver a message-spore.
quest_22002.MidwayText:
This message spore is from Mu? I see.

He understands me well. Tell him that so long as I am alive, I will serve him. But I must keep up appearances with Tidal, or be torn apart!
quest_22002.Name: Find Poe
quest_22002.PrefaceText: Most myconians have turned away from my counsel. But Poe  loyal Poe is out there somewhere. I don't really believe Poe has turned away from me. Find Poe and deliver this message-spore. And if Poe needs help, please do whatever is necessary.
quest_22002.SuccessText: Poe is alive? Thank you! In return, let me teach you what I can of our language. [You gain Myconic XP.]

quest_22101.Description: Way asked you to be on the lookout for his yo-yo, which he believes is in the posession of a sentinel spider.
quest_22101.Name: Way's Lost Yo-Yo
quest_22101.PrefaceText:
A few moons back, an elf visited us and gave me an exotic item called a 'yo-yo'. It has a string. It goes up and down via magic. I loved it!

Unfortunately I left it lying about, and one of the sentinel spiders took it to their nest. If you happen upon it, please return it.
quest_22101.SuccessText: That's it! But the string has been digested by spider acid. Sadness and happiness collide! Nevertheless, thank you.

quest_22102.Description: Way has asked for some string with which to fix Way's lucky yo-yo.
quest_22102.Name: Fixing Way's Yo-Yo
quest_22102.PrefaceText: Could you find me some replacement string for my yo-yo? It doesn't work anymore.
quest_22102.SuccessText: Thank you! Happy day! Here, let me shower you with human coins!

quest_22201.Description: Jaw the myconian has asked you to kill a bunch of Garden Tenders in the Myconian caverns.
quest_22201.Name: Too Many Tenders
quest_22201.PrefaceText: There are just so many Garden Tenders! It's hard to convince fellow myconians to resist Tidal when they see his massive army of tenders. They're so scary! Can you kill the scary monsters for us?
quest_22201.SuccessText: Well done! Well done! Here, take this. Never speak to anyone of what I asked you to do. They wouldn't understand.

quest_22202.Description: Jaw the myconian has asked you to kill Greta, the Garden Tender.
quest_22202.Name: Greta Must Die
quest_22202.PrefaceText:
Thanks for helping clear out some tenders, but there's still so many!

We buy our Garden Tenders from goblins. I do not know what their true species is; that's just what we call them. They are loyal and strong, but the goblins only sell us males. However, last season, they made a mistake. They left us a female! Now we have several females, but still only one at reproductive age. And you must kill her.

It is very sad, I know, but she is under the control of Tidal's renegade myconians. Look on the bright side: tenders are just meatlings, not mushrooms! Oh, I guess that doesn't help you, does it.
quest_22202.SuccessText: Hooray, you killed Greta! You are the cold-blooded murderer our pod needed! I'm confident that befriending such a violent sociopath as you cannot possibly have any negative repercussions. Here, take this token of our appreciation. Please do not kill us.

quest_22203.Description: Jaw the myconian has asked you to deliver sporelings to a storage cave somewhere in the myconian caverns.
quest_22203.Name: Cross-Pollination
quest_22203.PrefaceText: There is another seed repository deeper in the caves. I believe at least one myconian there will be friendly to you  can you go there and deliver these sporelings for safe keeping? We can't afford to keep all our sporelings in one place.
quest_22203.SuccessText: Thank you! Now if these storage mushrooms are destroyed, our pod can live on. Here, take these potions I found on a dead meatling. You like potions, right? Meatlings seem to love them for some reason. I guess it's because you have mouths.

quest_22301.Description: Voo the myconian asked for some Iocaine Mushrooms.
quest_22301.Name: Iocaine Samples
quest_22301.PrefaceText: I need more iocaine mushrooms. Can you obtain them?
quest_22301.SuccessText: Thank you. These are a little underripe, but they will do. Here... perhaps these toys will be useful to you?

quest_22401.Description: Glajur, a goblin you met under a tower in Kur Mountains, asked for humanoid skulls in order to continue his phrenological research.
quest_22401.Name: Looking at Skulls
quest_22401.PrefaceText: I had hoped to master the phrenological areas of humans and elves from the corpses in this crypt, but I didn't find nearly enough skulls. Could you find some humanoid skulls for me? There should be a few lying around in here. Or heck, if you have some from elsewhere, I'd take those too. I just need to continue my studies!
quest_22401.SuccessText: Great! Look, see this bump here? He points to an almost imperceptible bump on one of the skulls. Associated with feelings of neglect. And here, this skull has the same rise! All of the people here seem to have had low self esteem. How odd, I have to study this further. Oh, right after you left, I remembered there's a much easier way to get skulls. You can just use a skull extractor on corpses! Here, you can take mine.

quest_22402.Description: Glajur, a goblin you met under a tower in Kur Mountains, asked you to bring him some of the odd goblets lying about the dungeon.
quest_22402.Name: Necromancy Goblets
quest_22402.PrefaceText: I noticed something weird: there are a bunch of magical goblets lying around down here. They have necromantic magic, but I don't know what they do. If you find any of them, could you let me have them?
quest_22402.SuccessText: Hmm, they're warm! What was that old mnemonic we learned in school? "Hatred is Hot, Despair is Cold, Fear is Tingly, Greed is Slimy". (It rhymes in Goblin, but not in Common.) I guess... I guess I don't really know enough about Necromancy to tell what these do. But I'll study them. Thanks! Here, take some money for your trouble.

quest_22403.Description: Glajur, a goblin you met under a tower in Kur Mountains, asked you to bring him some impressive humanoid skulls.
quest_22403.Name: Better Skulls Needed
quest_22403.PrefaceText: I need better skulls to further my study. Look for humanoids that are especially brave, or daring, or horrifying. Pop out their skulls after you kill them, and see if the skulls look impressive.
quest_22403.SuccessText: Wow, these are better than I expected. But enough about that. I noticed that you didn't have much compunction about ripping the skulls out of your fellow creatures using a small knife. You must have a fucked up past! What? No memory? Well, here. This might help you remember things better.

quest_23001.Description: Yagreet at the fairy tree asked you for some Master First Aid Kits.
quest_23001.Name: Making Do With Crap Kits
quest_23001.PrefaceText: The first aid kits that seem common in this country are kind of underwhelming, even the so-called "Master" kits. But I can combine multiple kits to get the stuff I need. Unfortunately the druids don't bother with first aid kits, so I could really use a supply!
quest_23001.SuccessText: Thanks! I'll take the delicate surgical tape from each of these, and let's see, I can reinforce the little scalpel. Hmm, yeah, I can work with this. Here's something for your trouble. Mortals really like these silly documents!

quest_23002.Description: Yagreet at the fairy tree asked for some rubbery tongues, most commonly found on dead Ranalans.
quest_23002.Name: Tongues of The Ranalan
quest_23002.PrefaceText: I've been experimenting with the local fauna. The creatures here have interesting healing properties! I think I can use the tongues of those horrid little frog people as super-strong binding material for broken wings. I don't condone violence, but if you happen upon a dead frog man, you could maybe collect its tongue...
quest_23002.SuccessText: Oh, wow, I didn't realize the tongues were so long! I probably could have done with fewer of them. But thanks! Hmm, here! I brought a lot of these with me from the fae realm for their medicinal value, but mortals seem to like them because they're shiny.

quest_23101.Description: Eleme in Sun Vale has asked you to hack down any animated vines that pop up out of the ground.
quest_23101.Name: Blasted Vines
quest_23101.PrefaceText: There are plants out there that pop out of the ground to eat people. They followed us here from the Spring Court of the Fae, and they don't even belong in this world! We've told the druids all about them, but they just laugh and say they're harmless. Harmless enough to have killed Pyrale last week! Mow them down, if you see them!
quest_23101.SuccessText: Thank you. Maybe my people can forage in safety now! Take this as a gift.

quest_23102.Description: Eleme in Sun Vale has asked you to murder the Winter Court soldiers at the various encampments in Sun Vale.
quest_23102.Name: Encroaching Winter Camps

Objectives.Description: Kill Winter Court Fae Near Their Portals And Bases

quest_23102.PrefaceText: I've seen the Winter Court's outposts. They're staying in tiny dimensional pockets where they think they're safe. But they have to come out some time. Show them that their safety is an illusion.
quest_23102.SuccessText: They aren't really dead, you know. Not like mortals die. They'll be back within a week. But they'll not soon forget the pain you caused them! Thank you.

quest_23103.Description: Eleme in Sun Vale has asked you to kill elite Winter Court soldiers called The Boreal Fist. They are probably much too dangerous to take on alone.
quest_23103.Name: The Boreal Fist

Objectives.Description: Kill Boreal Fist troops or leaders

quest_23103.PrefaceText: We've done much to dissuade the Winter Court from attacking us directly. But there is a team of elite warriors that fear nothing. They are The Boreal Fist. If you can find allies to stand with you, can you strike them down? Be careful. Even I could not kill one of them alone.
quest_23103.SuccessText: You... really?! Amazing! Mortals are far more powerful than we were taught. That's... kind of scary, actually. I mean, thanks, but... you just, like, killed them? Huh. Here, take this, not that you need it. Here's a bunch of this Council money, too.

quest_23201.Description: Hiral at the fairy tree has asked for apple juice.
quest_23201.Name: Apple Juice
quest_23201.PrefaceText: I heard you have apples in this dimension! They don't seem to grow around here though. I wanted to taste the apple juice made from them to see if it's like home.
quest_23201.SuccessText: Thanks! Hiral drinks the juice. Huh. It is exactly the same, except it doesn't have the emotional tones that fairy foods have. That's a good thing in this case. Fae apple juice tastes like resignation and patience. Which is not really that thirst quenching. Hey, as trade, want this weird drug somebody gave me? He said it makes you able to 'multitask', which sounds tiresome, but maybe that's your thing?

quest_23202.Description: Hiral at the fairy tree has asked for some camembert cheese.
quest_23202.Name: Camembert
quest_23202.PrefaceText: We don't really get much cheese in the fae realm. I mean, the troll-dogs are technically milkable, but... ugh. This world's cheeses are amazing! I had a bite of one that I'd love to try again. It was called 'camembert'. Do you have any?
quest_23202.SuccessText: Thanks! I'm going to save this and share it with Yagreet later. She works so hard, you know? But hey, here. I brought it with me from the fae realm.

quest_23301.Description: Preta at the fairy tree asked you for a Gem Crusher, some sort of small tool.
quest_23301.Name: Preta Wants a Gem Crusher
quest_23301.PrefaceText: I'm experimenting with colored inks! I have some gems with me, but I didn't bring a gem crusher. Surely those exist on this plane of existence, right? Do you have a spare?
quest_23301.SuccessText: Oh, it's large! Well, I guess it's small for you. It's kind of unwieldy for a fairy. But I'll manage! Thank you so much!

quest_23401.Description: Agrashab the troll wants powdered dust that can sometimes be found inside animated plants.
quest_23401.Name: Powdered Mammal
quest_23401.SuccessText: Good. Will use dust for psychedelic drugs. Here.

quest_23501.Description: Yogzi in Sun Vale wants you to make him a bunch of simple skinning knives.
quest_23501.Name: Simple Knives
quest_23501.PrefaceText: Get started! Make simple skinning knives! I'll sell you the recipe. Then make me a bunch. Show your work. I'll grade you on quality and enthusiasm.
quest_23501.SuccessText: Hm. Quality is okay. Enthusiasm is not high enough! Be more enthusiastic!

quest_23502.Description: Yogzi in Sun Vale wants you to make him a bunch of basic skinning knives.
quest_23502.Name: Fancier Knives
quest_23502.PrefaceText: Practice makes perfect! Practice practice practice! When you think you're ready, make me some basic skinning knives.
quest_23502.SuccessText: Good! You're faking enthusiasm a bit better now! Keep it up.

quest_23503.Description: Yogzi in Sun Vale wants evidence of snail armor. He believes an innkeeper in Eltibule can teach the technique. A simple pair of snail-shell boots should suffice.
quest_23503.Name: Snail Armor
quest_23503.PrefaceText:
Some random wanderer told me that in a far off land, they make armor out of snail shells using the same techniques I use to make tools. Ridiculous, isn't it?

Go find out if it's true. Search far and wide! Leave no stone unturned!

Well, if you want a hint, sure... I heard that some inn keeper in Eltibule is an expert at using snail bits.
quest_23503.SuccessText: These boots are hideous! But I like them! You are industrious. Let me show you some clever toolcrafting techniques usually only taught to goblins.

quest_23504.Description: Yogzi in Sun Vale wants a bunch of Good Metal Slabs.
quest_23504.Name: Slabs for Yogzi
quest_23504.PrefaceText: I need to make fancy tools, but it's hard to find good metal on this island. Can you head to the mainland and survey some good metal slabs for me?
quest_23504.SuccessText: Perfect, perfect. This is good! Hmm, let me see what I can give you in return. Oh, I have a bunch of useless firewood. Here. Take it! Oh, sure, I can teach you a few toolcrafting tricks too, if you like.

quest_24001.Description: Corey the Croaker in the Winter Nexus asked you for fairy wings.
quest_24001.Name: Corey Wants Wings
quest_24001.PrefaceText: I know it's taboo to carry around fairy wings. But that's why they're so great! Nothing can rile up an Autumn or Summer like a big old bed full of ripped-off wings. Get me some, I'm gonna do something gross.
quest_24001.SuccessText: Hahaha okay this is gonna be great. You'll see. For now, here's a thing I found. Neat, huh?

quest_24002.Description: Corey the Croaker in the Winter Nexus asked you for ogre stomachs.
quest_24002.Name: Corey Wants Ogre Stomachs
quest_24002.PrefaceText: If you're gonna be murdering harmless ogres, can you collect their stomachs for me? I need 'em for fart bladders and other joke toys.
quest_24002.SuccessText: Hm, not bad. Here! This is for your trouble!

quest_24101.Description: Fazzi in the Winter Nexus asked you to kill an Ogre named Gorgos.
quest_24101.Name: Murdering Gorgos
quest_24101.PrefaceText: Ogres are all dumb as hell and mean to boot, but Gorgos is the biggest and dumbest one around here. He chased us back here! If he were to die suddenly... that'd be really convenient.
quest_24101.SuccessText: He's dead? Great! Now we can begin planning phase 2. Real soon. Here's mortal money for your task. What do you mortals call it? "Blood money?"

quest_24102.Description: Fazzi in the Winter Nexus asked you for some garnets.
quest_24102.Name: Garnets
quest_24102.PrefaceText: I'm surrounded by these stupid Winterhues in this nexus! So ugly! I wish I had some pretty gems. Garnets are my favorite!
quest_24102.SuccessText: Wow! Where'd you find garnets around here? I hope you didn't go to a lot of trouble for me! Here are some of my prettier gems in exchange!

quest_24201.Description: Furlak in the Winter Nexus might like it if you killed some orcs. Just a thought.
quest_24201.Name: Orc Raiders
quest_24201.PrefaceText: Favor? I just want to go home! I need to get home and help keep the orc raiders from taking out the caravans. Damned orcs.
quest_24201.SuccessText: What, you just ran off and killed some random orcs because I was complaining about orcs in my desert back home? Wow. Just... wow. I mean, thanks, sure, that's... nice of you.

quest_24301.Description: Selaxi in Amulna asked for some carrots. She mentioned that there's a small garden lot in Amulna where you could grow them.
quest_24301.Name: Fresh Carrots
quest_24301.PrefaceText:
Can you run over to Kelim's little garden -- it's over in the corner of town -- and see if he's going to have more carrots any time in the next year? He just keeps growing peppers!

You know what, don't bother talking to the lout. Just get me carrots!
quest_24301.SuccessText: Yes! Carrots! Kelim keeps saying they're super difficult to grow, but that doesn't make any sense, does it? They can't be any harder to grow than, say, a potato. Anyway, thanks! Here, take these. A dozen potatoes for a half-dozen carrots seems like a good trade, right?

quest_24302.Description: Selaxi in Amulna has asked you to obtain giant hairballs. The most common source is grimalkin in the desert.
quest_24302.Name: Hairballs Are Edible?!
quest_24302.PrefaceText: Hmm, can I trust you? Well, I guess I have no choice. One of the secret ingredients in my signature dish is ground up grimalkin hair. But not just ordinary hair -- it's got to be covered in their spit! If you find some of those giant hairballs, bring them to me, okay?
quest_24302.SuccessText:
Ugh, they stink! Just... put them over there. Now, what do I owe you? Oh, right, you were doing me a favor! So I owe you nothing but my thanks. Thanks!

Fine, fine, here, take this money also.

quest_24401.Description: Urzab in Amulna asked for a Nice Meditation Stool.
quest_24401.Name: A Nice Stool
quest_24401.PrefaceText: Rakshasa make furniture that's too uncomfortable! Can you get me a decent stool? One of those nice meditation stools should do. I need something I can sit on for hours at a time.
quest_24401.SuccessText: Hmm... not as nice as I expected. If I wear my kilt I'll get splinters! But thanks, I'll try using it with my robes. Here, you can have my old kilt if you like.

quest_24402.Description: Urzab in Amulna asked for Carnelians.
quest_24402.Name: Carnelians for Urzab
quest_24402.PrefaceText: I have family back in Sedgewick Forest: my lovely wife, our bear, and three gobs. But the clan infighting is too dangerous there. I need to make it big here so I can bring my family over. In the short term, though, I need to send back resources that my wife can turn into weapons. Have you come across any carnelians? They're perfect for making magic swords. Say, a half-dozen of them?
quest_24402.SuccessText: Carnelians! Give them to me! Hahaha! Here, take this trinket. We're even! No debts!

quest_24403.Description: Urzab in Amulna asked for Manticore tail spikes.
quest_24403.Name: Manticore Tails Needed!
quest_24403.PrefaceText: This is a perfect spot for a jewelry shop because those hideous manticores love jewelry! If you kill them, bring their jewelry here to sell. And if you really want to get on my good side, bring me their tail spikes. I'm shipping them home for my wife to turn into powerful poison knives!
quest_24403.SuccessText: Thank you. Pashub will turn these into horrific stilettos! Here, this is one of her earlier works.

quest_24501.Description: Makara in the Ilmari Desert asked you to find an odd crystal. She said it could be found in yeti caves deep beneath the Kur Mountains.
quest_24501.Name: The Weird Prism
quest_24501.PrefaceText:
Prisms are useful for a few special crafting tasks. I can make ordinary prisms, but I've heard of a strange prism made by an ancient yeti master. I wish to study it! Find it for me?

It would be in some cave in the Kur Mountains, I presume. I doubt it would be easy to find, since I've only heard vague rumors of it. It's probably in some sack deep down in a hole somewhere.
quest_24501.SuccessText: This is it! Hm. These sigils attune it to a specific species. That's not supposed to be possible! I will have to study this more. Oh, here. These are boring old regular prisms in exchange.

quest_25001.Description: Kill the Scion of Norala, a huge wolf deep within the wolf cave in Kur Mountains.
quest_25001.Name: Wolf: Kill the Scion of Norala
quest_25001.PrefaceText: Norala believes in the rule of might. If you can kill the Scion of Norala, then you should do so. If you die, then you were too weak to live.
quest_25001.SuccessText:
Confirmed: the Scion of Norala is dead.

You have received 1 token of Norala.

quest_25002.Description: Prove that even mighty orcs are no match for Norala's chosen. Killing fifty of them should demonstrate this well.
quest_25002.Name: Wolf: Orcish Genocide
quest_25002.PrefaceText: Prove that even mighty orcs are no match for Norala's chosen. Killing fifty of them should demonstrate this well.
quest_25002.SuccessText:
Confirmed: 50 orcs slain.

You have received 1 token of Norala.

quest_25003.Description: Show that you are a top predator. Mercilessly hunt down deer.
quest_25003.Name: Wolf: Hunt Deer
quest_25003.PrefaceText: Show that you are a top predator. Mercilessly hunt down deer.
quest_25003.SuccessText:
Confirmed: 25 deer slain.

You have received 1 token of Norala.

quest_25004.Description: Humans, Elves, and Rakshasa deem themselves "civilized", and they shun Norala. Teach them the folly of their ways.
quest_25004.Name: Wolf: Civilized Races
quest_25004.PrefaceText: Humans, Elves, and Rakshasa deem themselves "civilized", and they shun Norala. Teach them the folly of their ways.
quest_25004.SuccessText:
Confirmed: 50 humans, elves, rakshasa dead.

You have received 1 token of Norala.

quest_25005.Description: The fae believe they are superior to mortals. Norala rewards those who punish the unjustly arrogant.
quest_25005.Name: Wolf: Fae Destruction
quest_25005.PrefaceText: The fae believe they are superior to mortals. Norala rewards those who punish the unjustly arrogant.
quest_25005.SuccessText:
Confirmed: 50 fae creatures dead.

You have received 1 token of Norala.

quest_25006.Description: In a dungeon beneath Eltibule there is a mighty avatar shackled into servitude. This is unacceptable. Slay Ciervos The Shadow to relieve his humiliation.
quest_25006.Name: Wolf: Ciervos Must Die
quest_25006.PrefaceText: In a dungeon beneath Eltibule there is a mighty avatar shackled into servitude. This is unacceptable. Slay Ciervos The Shadow to relieve his humiliation.
quest_25006.SuccessText:
Confirmed: Ciervos the Shadow is dead.

You have received 1 token of Norala.

quest_25007.Description: Goblins are weak and deserve destruction. Make it happen.
quest_25007.Name: Wolf: Goblin Killing
quest_25007.PrefaceText: Goblins are weak and deserve destruction. Make it happen.
quest_25007.SuccessText:
Confirmed: 50 goblins slain.

You have received 1 token of Norala.

quest_25008.Description: Kill the Scion of Discord, a warrior deep within a hidden cave in the Eltibule region.
quest_25008.Name: Wolf: Kill the Scion of Gulagra
quest_25008.PrefaceText: The chosen of Gulagra has been found! Norala tells us he is deep beneath the earth in Eltibule. Calling himself the Scion of Discord, he believes he is the fiercest warrior alive. This cannot be. Prove it.
quest_25008.SuccessText:
Confirmed: the Scion of Discord is dead.

You have received 1 token of Norala.

quest_25009.Description: The freakish half-dragon creatures are weak. They hide behind the might of their dragon ancestors. They should be rooted out.
quest_25009.Name: Wolf: Dragon-Kin
quest_25009.PrefaceText: The freakish half-dragon creatures are weak. They hide behind the might of their dragon ancestors. They should be rooted out.
quest_25009.SuccessText:
Confirmed: 10 dragon-kin slain.

You have received 1 token of Norala.

quest_25010.Description: It is poison to our kind, but we can overcome it and grow even mightier. Collect wolfsbane and bring it here as an offering.
quest_25010.Name: Wolf: Wolfsbane
quest_25010.PrefaceText: It is poison to our kind, but we can overcome it and grow even mightier. Collect wolfsbane and bring it here as an offering.
quest_25010.SuccessText:
Confirmed: 10 wolfsbane delivered.

You have received 1 token of Norala.

quest_25011.Description: Orcs are still too prevalent! This angers Norala! Murder them!
quest_25011.Name: Wolf: Orcish Genocide 2
quest_25011.PrefaceText: Orcs are still too prevalent! This angers Norala! Murder them!
quest_25011.SuccessText:
Confirmed: 100 orcs slain.

You have received 1 token of Norala.

quest_25012.Description: Show that your hunger is insatiable. Hunt more deer.
quest_25012.Name: Wolf: Hunt Deer 2
quest_25012.PrefaceText: Show that your hunger is insatiable. Hunt more deer.
quest_25012.SuccessText:
Confirmed: 50 deer slain.

You have received 1 token of Norala.
